Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

HVR3AupiAtWJaqy2CVSz4g.text: The first place we visited on our trip. We elected to wait a bit for lunch instead of breakfast and I'm so glad we did. I love the selections for building your own mash. The staff was extremely friendly; I even noticed one man giving directions to someone outside. The food was phenomenal. We also had a blackberry and apple pie for dessert which was good. As a side note.. this is a very tiny place and if you have a group larger than 4 it might be a bit uncomfortable. But for two is was perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

eJk3ICnq_E2zhZPG1g029A.text: The horseradish mashed potatoes were to die for!  I ordered the chicken pie to accompany my side dish and it didn't disappoint. However the meat gravy tasted gamey. My son ordered the steak pie and it was super peppery. My daughter's sausage was drier than what I'm used to.  The service was fast.

y_bkcx8jeht-hR_hYip1uA.text: The most comforting, warm, homey meal. I will dream of that steak pie and gravy! Cheaply priced too in my opinion. Lively, fun location. Loved loved loved.

Bo4QPbyN4SnRAAGoRKQ3jQ.text: Small restaurant in Soho where tables are close and service is fast.  Stick to pie and mash + a local craft beer and skip the espresso.  Not busy early week, they do take reservations. Lots of pie and mash in town, would only return if close by.

_4K56dk2iZ_SHf2-vpAyMQ.text: Never had a British pie before but I'm glad I decided to give this place a try while visiting London. I like the simplicity of the 3 step menu and the food was tasty. I ended up getting the Angus steak pie, the champ mash, with traditional gravy which was a good combination. The mash was loaded with scallions so be sure to have mints or gum available! I would return if ever back in London

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

3bkgVqeOGG9ECBSU67zBoQ.text: Coming from North America, I'd long thought of "British food" as sort of a punchline to a bad joke: something to be endured, snickered at, not savored. But traditional English food is in reality hearty, delicious, and suited to the terroir; it has no less merit than any other European cuisine, it's just that it's too often executed horribly by Greene King pubs and their ilk. So a thought a few weeks ago, why does this have to be so? Mother Mash, I'm pleased to report, does traditional English food justice. Everything is prepared with care using great ingredients. The dishes are flavorful and the surroundings hip, cozy, and convivial, not kitschy. I had the bubble and squeak, Angus beef pie, and Farmers gravy, washed down with Bulmer's. The prices are very good for what you get. The service left a bit to be desired, although this was in part due to a language barrier with some of the waitstaff. Nonetheless, I'll be visiting Mother Mash again, as I applaud both the concept and the execution thereof.

r-K6aipCzgWYknqmd7weKg.text: We loved the concept of the restaurant so we decided to give it a try. We enjoyed going step by step and picking out our mash, meat and gravy! My dad is vegetarian so he was really excited to have their sweet potato mash, veggie gravy and veggie pie! He really did enjoy it! My mom and I both had the cheesy mash, traditional pork bangers and traditional gravy. It was good but nothing special in my opinion. The gravy was too thin and the mash wasn't cheesy at all. I wasn't too impressed. My dad was very happy with his meal though.

A4rjpeMCu_T9ggfaybZjCQ.text: Bangers and mash galore. Cheap, centrally located, fast, and tasty. You can't ask for more from this sort of place. The menu has you choose either sausages (2) or a pie, and then pair that with a mash and a gravy. We sampled a couple types of sausage, as well as the classic and sweet potato mashes. Everything was tasty. The sausages were juicy and very flavorful. The mashes were also good. The protons aren't huge, but then they don't need to be with such heavy food. A good spot for a quick lunch break while walking SoHo.

Cb0Txhab3yF9FT4GGgMERQ.text: If you want the option of several types of bangers, mash, and gravies, then this is the place to go! I went with 3 other people and everyone was happy with their meal. I personally had cheesy mash with a regular pork sausage, and I forget the name of the gravy I had but it had red wine in it. It was really good!Our table shared sticky pudding and that was really good, as well! I give this place a thumbs up as in its good to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Cheesy mash, regular pork bangers, and farmers gravy.

cvReJxoMsqyK_BTuKqpsUA.text: Quaint little place with good service and great food. Clean, fast, reasonably priced and an original take on traditional English food.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Horseradish mash, steak & ale pie, a London Smokey and traditional gravy. Delicious!

mtGrqibPU_PUdp7kesI4TA.text: Located in the midst of Soho...Mother Mash is a must! It's a small restaurant so be prepared to wait, but believe me when I tell you it's worth it. The service leaves much to be desired but I didn't mind because Mother Mash knows how to do an amazing bangers and mash. The mash was cheesy and warm while the bangers were spectacularly delicious. I couldn't finish my meal but I remember regretting not taking it home (we were on the way to the London Eye). The menu is small but that's what it needs to be especially when they make amazing food! You won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. If you're not looking you'll miss it!
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. outside of the restaurant
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. My amazing bangers & mash

KuCytrd9KhoxevVym0KPbw.text: The owner and waitress were both very nice. The owner even went to the next door pub to get me a cup of ice . He's also quite a sight for sore eyes. The restaurant is longer than wide but has seating further inside so dont be off-put by what you see through the window. Must come for some bangers and mash in London Soho

2SfFc-d3DoJmwn7FYgs17Q.text: This place was so good! We walked in about 30 min before closing! All of us got different things such as pies or bangers. Food is so good! Huge portions! Even after eating and finishing we just hung out there and even as they were closing (we didn't realize) they were so nice and didn't kick us out!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Mediterranean veggie pie, cheesy mash, with veggie gravy!

X628wVlsRZA5LklJ9cCJFg.text: Loved the place! It is not very big restaurant as it is in a busy part of London, but the booths are quite cozy. The guy that helped us was very nice and helpful and the food came out quick. The food was delicious and I particularly loved the gravy. Great place to have a proper British meal at an affordable price.

zY3X2_DuwrKgGiRKC_kgjg.text: The mash potatoes here are absolutely FANTASTIC and to die for. Very soft and creamy with a smooth texture that just melts in your mouth. They also have a great selection of different delicious sausages and scrumptious pies. Very reasonably priced with outstanding service, I definitely recommend coming by at least once if you're in town :)

nB8XuPzzZbGfPID0VI-iDA.text: Had a great meal there.  The lamb and mint sausage was great. Everyone in the family enjoyed the traditional English "mash". It's surprisingly family friendly for being in Soho.  Def make a reservation for this small, but quaint place.

mJJ_5ZzX_HDWGfNj7MdjRg.text: Stopped here because of Yelp reviews.  It was not a direct Tube route for us, so we were disappointed the first night when we were turned away because the entire restaurant was booked for a private party.  Since we really wanted to try the sausage and pie with mash, we came back the next day, but they were out of the traditional mince meat pie... another disappointment.  I had the cheesy mustard mash, chicken pie, and farmers gravy while Hubby had the cheesy mash, London smokey sausage, and farmers gravy.  Both were good.  On top of the previous disappointments, they did not take American Express.  I would not rate the food as THAT good to overcome being turned away the first night, out of mince meat pie, and no acceptance of AmEx.  Mother Mash would have earn an extra star if we just ran into it rather than trying to live up to the hype.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Cheesy mustard mash, chicken pie, and farmers gravy

ipwKdZ-IrRHaNDLqHpatWg.text: Delish! Come early- it can get very busy. I had steak pie, bubble and squeak, farmer gravy on the recommendation of the charming young lady "Ash".

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

vidFbD4E0oXSgGLjO4OAHQ.text: Bad service straight up, rather go to places next the street is full of great places dont eat here

9GWyFGhAlGxoPTxu_8BeCA.text: Been trying to find a place where offers vegetarian and non-vegetarian menu to go with my friends (since some of us are vegetarian and some are quite picky), luckily I found Mother Mash. It is very close to Oxford Circus, relatively cheap with its location. No so busy on a Saturday night (maybe because of the heavy rain?). There are different combinations and side dishes to order, every of us was happy, we got what we wanted. I had pork and chilli sausages, it was quite hot, I liked it! Mash was smooth and I ordered some garden peas, perfect match.However, the high wooden benches were too high in my opinion, even there was a sort of footrest (single metal pole), couldn't fit 4 of us... and the seat was shallow with a straight 90 degree angle back. Just not comfortable at all... We decided not to give any tips, because the waitress wasn't friendly or attentive. The waiter was good, but he was gone at the end of our meal. I will go again, because of the affordable price range.

rkUguy5k_ISUE2rs_eybXg.text: Went for an early dinner at Mother Mash. Surprisingly no wait we were sitted within a minute and were given the menus on  boards - very cool presentation. Having a pretty similar taste we all got the mash with the steak pie and the traditional gravy. The pie, mash and gravy were excellent. Gravy nice and not too thick. Pies had a good balance of dough to filling with the filling having an excellent taste. The mash was good and made from real spuds. One disappointment - the horseradish mash was the regular mash with horseradish sauce. Could be better. Overall good food. Service was one of the most friendly ones I ever had. Can't beat a winning combination. Would be back.

Ujft12Laa8kz_2NnuZ_3fw.text: SOLID meat pies! I went here twice in a week to get my fill before heading out.I had the Steak and Ale the first time and the Lamb Hot Pot Pie the 2nd time.I prefer the steak and ale pie. It had more meat to speak of.Mashed potatoes just plain with traditional gravy did the trick for me but you can add all sorts of other things to it if you care to dress it up a bit.Apple pie for dessert with hot custard is my pro tip- Do not leave without ordering it.The sticky toffee pudding was forgettable.Service. First time we were walk ins. It was crowded but we got a table.2nd time we made a booking.The staff is not English- well, most of them. Service seemed a little cold however on our second trip there we had a "New" server with a shaved head. He seemed very energetic but had the WORST body odor ever. I didn't want him to come near us cause it was so offensive.

Qa5vPbKda8XNocNh0gKzjw.text: We really liked this place!! Our pies, gravy and mash were all yummy!! I had the steak pie with the cheese mash and some sort of garlic gravy... YUM!! I loved the area of this restaurant as well!!

viZSqY8KfU-O6BkglqJRBg.text: This place has one of the pure English dish I wanted to try: the mash. Brits like their food all in one bowl (or one pie) and in my very uneducated and uninformed opinion, this was the real deal. You can either get it as a pure mash, which I think means meat, mashed potatoes and gravy all together or more accurately in a pile. Or you get the meat in a pie with gravy and mash on top. I had the beef pie: it was Very good. The simple menu comes down to this: with pie or just in a pile?  The gravy is thin and very rich/flavorful. After a bowl of beef and mash there is not much room for anything else. It's difficult not to feel satisfied. It is a little place, and in a kind of winding set of streets in SoHo. Cool atmosphere and friendly staff. I'm not sure locals flock here but I found it to be good, even if it is not authenticity local.

KIf7mL1UzayIIXVrSjpKdw.text: If the service were better here, my rating would be so much higher.  I mean...COME ON!  The concept alone is brilliant!1) Choose a mash (5 delicious options to choose from, although my favourite is the cheesy mustard mash)2) Choose a sausage or pie (from one of the many options available).  Check out their specials board as well for any savoury treats to complement your tasty mash.3) Choose a flavourful gravy.All for a very reasonable  price!Again...the service leaves MUCH to be desired, but the food is good and the price is just as good.

mNd-ZR0Yeyp74q_Kb89iqQ.text: When I came in on a Friday evening to find the place almost empty, I had some concerns. It's never a good sign when a restaurant is empty on a Friday night. I'm still unsure as to why there was barely anyone here for dinner, because the food was great. I had the horseradish bashed potatoes (slightly textured, not buttery smooth like the mashed) and the pie of the day which was a lamb pot pie. The potatoes were delicious and the pie was amazing. Flaky crust with perfectly cooked lamb inside. The sausage of the day was a wild boar apple sausage, and that was really good as well. Definitely worth a try if you're in the area. Very well priced, too.

LXObZ-MvXCeexbYn_nr-7A.text: Great food! I got the bashed cheddar mash and two sausages ( premium pork and smokey London - both were delicious but couldn't really tell a difference). The mash and traditional gravy were good as well. Husband had the Angus steak pie and said it was great but the onion gravy only so-so. I took off one star for service as it was extremely slow ( especially to get the bill!)  and I had asked for my gravy on the side but it came all over the plate :/

BZecV26YdP1xnBk3VIQ2iA.text: Homely sausage and mash, or meat pies if that's more your thing, with lashings of gravy mmmmm. I wouldn't say this is the best sausage and mash I've had, but they definitely have a huge selection of sausages, mash and gravies. It's a mix and match so you choose your sausages / pie, then choose the mash and the gravy. Portions don't look enormous but don't be fooled - it's a lot more filling than it looks! I've never managed dessert after this!

RYMNe0ZwGYKZSF2_iBkVmw.text: Warm, friendly diner setting for some delicious bangers and mash (I recommend the Horseradish mash) and farmers gravy. The berry cider was also a great taste to wash that hearty meal down. Ready for a walk-about? Yeah, Let's go!

xe1RUg2_5SFHrvhA50K06A.text: I'm on a carbo diet but I love mash, so couldn't resist checking Mother Mash. Ordering is a 3 step process. First you choose the type of mash, then either pie or sausage and followed by the gravy. Ordered the cheesy mash with mustard and the steak & ale pie. Waitress recommended the farmer's gravy. Finished everything and even added a sausage. Mash with French seeded mustard is a great combination, cannot taste the cheese most likely overpowered by the mustard. Steak & Ale pie crust was full of flavor (buttery) and crumbles in your mouth. Sausage was so-so a bit over burnt. Will go back after I run-off the carbo from this meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

9XMkSm0x0Z6RRqPqpFopIw.text: I'm a huge fan of mash. And pie. And gravy, so Mother Mash was a place I wanted to try for awhile. I came here for a substantial dinner before going to an event later in the evening. So the premise is simple: Choose a mash, choose a topping and choose a gravy. There's about five different mashes to choose from. I call it a topping, but it's really a pie or sausages. There are several pie and sausage options, so you can come back and try more. There are usually specials for the sausages and mash as well. Then you get to choose a gravy. There are a few types of that as well, so you can find something that tempts your palate. I had champ mash (potatoes, cheese and scallions) with a steak and kidney pie (from the specials) and farmer's gravy. I also got a side of buttered cabbage (for the veg, right?) The food was alright. The mash was well done and creamy. The gravy was packed full of flavor and rich, but there was something slightly off about it. My pie was were I was disappointed though. The crust is pretty terrible. It's hard and not nice or flaky at all. I didn't find any kidney in my steak and kidney pie, so I think it was just a steak pie. You can't really beat the price though. I got it all for slightly over a tenner. And I was really full when leaving. If I'm in the area and looking for a cheap meal, I'd probably come back. There's not much seating though, so I can see how during busy hours this may not be an option. I'd probably also get sausages instead, because the pie crust was just such a disappointment for me.

bw-_t3grbu6f24kn41RIog.text: I literally could have stayed here all day drinking and eating the mash. Great beers, great bangers and mash (try the sweet pots), and the Lincolnshire! Great staff too.

a3zs_Kj4NpEBwK8dXgol-g.text: They close early if they run out of food. Open until 10:00 PM and we arrived at 9:15 PM and the waitress told us they were closed. That sucks.

zYBNSImA2nWmLdFAmqBsSQ.text: Traditional gravy is the best gravy Ive ever tasted. Cheesy mash potato is my favorite compared to classic one. Pork sausage is rather dry, but minced beef pie tastes delicious. I would recommend this place to those people who are looking for new experiences in British delicacies!

VI1jZ_X3TFqdIypnWxUTwQ.text: Nice combinations of flavors centered around great mashed potatoes. The angus steak pie mash was great.

5DPYFA21NcqspVPHilx_qw.text: I visited here a few years ago and was keen to return when I was in London last week. This place does exactly what it says on the tin: Mash! And sausages and pies. they do veggie options too which is good for us!I was however little disappointed with this visit. The decor had got a little scruffy and the service wasn't very good. But when you want a quick bite of something warm and satisfying, and near Carnaby Street then it's worth going.  Had it been a bit neater inside and the service a bit better I would have honoured a 4* as the food is really pretty good.

_H8sXv7wPUX0HC9z8Sku5A.text: If you want great comfort food, as well as something quintessentially British, not to mention well priced, this is the place.  Lots of other great restaurants, pubs and shopping right around this restaurant (including a Red Wings shoe store).  Everything on the menu is good -- you can't go wrong -- unless you're on a diet, then this is not the place for you because it's not light fare.

eYMFGuCb3gGO2XGCkKzmIw.text: Amazingly awesomeness!!! Delicious, full of bold flavors, accompanied by a beer, makes a perfect afternoon meal, and to close a apple and blackberry pie. All of this accompanied with great and attentive service.

4QYE5VG9PUDFd_hVnqxj6A.text: I recently returned to Mother Mash after frequenting it on a regular basis when I first moved to London 5 years ago and was delighted to see it was still a wonderful, casual and fun restaurant with friendly service and delicious food at a decent price but in the heart of London. I used to always have sausage and mash in some shape or form but on this occasion I was there with my friend and workmate who was a pie lover so I joined her in having a chicken, leek and ham pie with farmer's gravy and colcannon mash which was so tasty and I'd highly recommend it. It was also really filling. We plumped for a bottle of the Chilean Merlot to share too which went down extremely well! I was so pleased with my return to Mother Mash and my friend is now a convert too and has returned twice since our visit. the only poor feature of the place is the uncomfortable and slidey seats! Recommend!

-cDNCJK7OsZpLpHnN3RUGg.text: Fantastic. Just what we needed on our next to the last night in London. I wish we had gone earlier in our trip so we could have gone more than once.

vkn1RHlEXCfSM0eLT-XKhA.text: I have loved Mother Mash since it opened and thought it would be just the ticket for a catch up with a friend. Said friend had commented that when he moved back to NZ he would at least be able to get a decent pie, even if the Auckland nightlife doesn't compare to the glitz, glamour, variety and downright bizarreness that have characterised our nights (and early mornings) in Landaaahn. I saw this as a direct challenge and wanted to prove him wrong, as being a native Londoner I am nothing if not competitive.So - Mother Mash -  sparked my inner map, they do a good pie and a consistent sausage. Nothing to set the world on fire but still good. That's before we think about the mash.. oooh what a balm on a dreary day.Well colour me disappointed. Its been a year since I went there and I was let down sadly in my choices.. The sausages were an excellent new variety, smoky, but overcooked. I opted for the horseradish mash, imagining the wonderful mother mash mash warmed throughout by the heat and bite of  grated horseradish. Imagine my dismay when the mash arrived with a dollop of runny horseradish sauce on the SIDE. The SIDE. Bucking the trend that is the Mother Mash, with everything expertly blended and presented into the mash experience that I have on many an occasion. Thank the mother then that my friends meal was good - an excellent angus pie, cheesy mustard mash, the usual. This would have tipped my score up a star but the gravy was far more gloopy than I recall and had a whiff of the packet about it. I don't think it is but... not as good as my previous experiences and it was always so solid and consistent. I don't know if I would head back now, given the array of experience that there is on offer around Carnaby Street.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Menu choices..  too many mash options!

3n1ol91PU_tsWHc3ymwF3g.text: Delicious pies and mash! Came here for dinner for the first time while visiting London and was not disappointed. They offer a wide selection of mash potatoes, pies or sausages, and gravy. I ordered the Colcannon Mash, Chicken Leek and Bacon Pie, and Farmers gravy. The portion is large for what you pay, you will definitely leave more than satisfied. Also offer delicious beer and wine as well. Overall good spot to try British food, would recommend to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

L8DHldkLqJlDyJ0ltsN_jg.text: I love bangers and mash, and I was told this is the place for it.It is a small restaurant with friendly servers and a simple menu. First, you choose your mash. We tried the Champ Mash, the Colcannon Mash, and the Bubble and Squeak. My favourite was the Champ Mash -- it was flavourful; I've never thought to put spring onions in my mash! We could hardly finish all the mash because they give such generous portions. Then, you choose your sausage(s) or pie. Out of the sausages we tried (Pork and Chilli, Lincolnshire, Pork and Leek, and Venison which was the special of the day), my favourite was the Pork and Leek. It was a good combination, but the other sausages were nothing special. We also tried the Chicken, Leek and Bacon pie but after I took a bite of it, I wish we had ordered more sausages instead, because it was really dry...Finally, you choose your gravy. Farmer's gravy was the best because I love bacon and mushrooms. The Traditional and Chicken gravies were decent.To be honest, I was expecting extraordinary bangers and mash with all the good reviews and the price we paid. If you're already in the area looking for some comfort food, it's all right, but I would definitely not go out of my way to try Mother Mash.

JHjap0jlANMklWNR77ynGg.text: A must go every time I am in London !The place is not very big but it never seems to be empty ! The recipe for the success of this place is great and easy : pie or sausages, mash and gravy...brillant confort food !

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Delicious beef & Guinness sausages the special today

2S4szXATEk0dnXUajW_Mqg.text: Was pretty good! Nice service and quick. Not as good as I expected from the reviews but was my first meat pie experience. I would definitely go again! Very cute little street it's located on as well.

HIb7ghjUm3ojBbRcyJIILw.text: 1st dinner Pitstop when arrived in London. Very cool menu set up, food was really good. Service was decent. If your looking for an affordable , good place to grab some "classic" London food , this is it.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Champ mash + steak pie + gravy (with red wine )

8FOYhyBQZELuMqlgMetBjg.text: thus place was great for a fancy pie and mask place . I loved all the different mash and gravy options - champ mash and farmers gravy were by far our favorite . especially when paired with the Angus pie . super rich and hearty food - don't go here expecting to wanna move much after

wxMD5Hp5fTKUil4fi8-wgw.text: May I call this British comfort food?  We loved having all the choices of mash, pie or bangers, and choice of sauce.  We had the special pork and cider pie, regular mash and farmers sauce - so rich and delicious.  We also ordered premium pork sausage, and an angus steak pie along with the mushy peas and bubble and squeak to try them.  We enjoyed lagers and the blush cider.We tried to return another night and the place was full but the Closed sign was up.  We did not try to question this, assuming that they had a large group that had booked the small space.  We noticed school groups and theater goers the first time that we were there.  We suggest that you call before you go.I was dreaming of trying the mash (with potato chunks) with horseradish, steak pie and farmers gravy and downing it with the blush cider.  Maybe next trip...The surrounding neighborhood is a hoot with all the tourists and after work as the office workers/drinkers fill all of the bars in the alleyways - it's quite the party atmosphere!

isUZHAGRPzPh2uCdZE1tew.text: Great consept that delivers what it promis. We ordered clasic mase, sauce and pie. It came quickly served by a friendly staff, and tasted greate. No exceptionel dinner, but well recommendable to a relative low price.

7yLzZ9Ntqq6_KEGEhjFxxQ.text: The waitress couldn't  speak English. She didn't know anything about the food she was serving. The other waitress seemed to know more but she was not very patient. I left because I wasn't able to order the food I wanted.

8z30V2JKMEov8D_Z8WigFg.text: Really good food and simple, yet attentive, atmosphere.  The number of choices was great. The only item that we did not find solid was the apple crumb.  The crumb was not browned and extremely doughy.  The place was also packed which was a good sign.

tx1OWnpWzMae2_aq__OaWg.text: £6.50 for takeaway! So much food and so filling. I got the vegetable pie and the champ mash with chicken gravy. Everything was delicious. I was surprised to find such a good deal for food on Oxford but I'm glad I did! Service is fast and everyone is very nice.

DF6uoR0eRWn-Riisgystxg.text: Great place to eat if you're trying to save some money! Food was warm would have been better hot but was still good and worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Cheesy potatoes, chicken bacon and leek pie, and onion gravy

Nen0-UbT3kPBVv9U8ormKg.text: This was my first experience with pies and mash on a recent trip to London. I WANT TO EAT THEM EVERY DAY FOR THE REST OF MY LIFE!!!!!!! This food was so warm and comforting, the flavors and textures were great, and the gravy was so beautiful and glossy that I almost didn't want to eat it. I also enjoyed the sticky toffee pudding and the honey cake--both smothered with delicious custard. My only reason for not offering five stars is that they were out of several of the pies (and it was only 6:30pm). Oh well, I guess that means the food is fresh.Can't wait for another excuse to go to London and eat at Mother Mash.

VqoFQiIdVutlVwt0F3UKLw.text: Really good, great pies food was baked in the moment and the service was nice and lovely

yjJAdxMRmwKSy_l7M06tuA.text: If you think that the place offers a range of pies and several types of mash, you've guessed right. The spot is structured in a classic English way and you can order all of those bloody delicious things like sausages, pie and mash with gravy. The spot is awesome but they sometimes tend to get out of some of the food quite early so be prepared to not get what you wanted initially.

KabDcOqr7sx29QCI9v-8_w.text: Mother Mash's pies and mash were so good that I came here a few times on my trip!  Nothing on the menu was too out there.  Just solid pies, sausages, and mash.The concept is really simple.  Pick the type of mash you want, pick a pie or sausage, and then a gravy to top it off.  That's all there is to it.

qebw0iqkm5MXHKiYWFdxmw.text: Very enjoyable place.  The mash is, indeed, excellent.  The horseradish mash in particular was a stand out.  Pies were flavorful, and the gravy tasty.I do wish the place had more ambiance and better seating.  It feels a bit fast-food in the layout and size of the tables.  It also only has beer in bottle, nothing on tap, unfortunately.

EgXwbppqPD5YAV7pogFORA.text: Sumptuous mashed potatoes drizzled with steaming gravy is the regular if not only option at this hidden gem of a restaurant. One may chose from a variety of sausage options or a comfortable selection of pies to accompany their choice of gravy and mashed potatoes. Unfortunately, on the day I decided to go a large portion of the menu was unavailable due to supplier issues. This left me with a simple Irish mash, steak pie and onion gravy. I walked out nearly 40 minutes later feeling like a true Londoner having sampled what must be labelled as the best of colloquial British food. The mash was creamy smooth, the pie was perfectly moist and the gravy was served generously. I ended with a treacle and custard dessert that left me feeling happy and indulged. Critiques include a lack of space in the restaurant, obviously the annoying lack of options due to the aforementioned supplier issue and slow, although very kind, service. I will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Unfortunately the family got to I before I could snap a proper pic. Nevertheless it was delicious.
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

zy0WrW6P4aYCFe7bWhxPCg.text: We stumbled upon this restaurant while wandering through Carnaby. We ordered cheddar mustard mash with Angus pie & traditional gravy and Irish mash with butternut squash pie and red wine gravy. Delicious. I liked that you could order a sausage by the link for £1.5 -- wild boar & apple was yummy. The side of grilled French beans was a nice way to lighten up the dish, but the mixed veggies were lackluster. Wish I'd thought to look to see if pints were available; that would have nicely rounded out the meal. Service was a bit inattentive, but not horrid. Would definitely make a return visit to Mother Mash.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Simple concept, great food

A-YD2qHNQ7wIiE18FkKzkQ.text: Totally awesome! Great service and delicious food. Staff was very friendly. Also, bubble and squeak tastes way better than it sounds! Lol!

_idVWmcDji_CWsHgXzsnMQ.text: Very good restaurant with very helpful service and yummi food

2cNJ2CQtwx9PhKwp0D54vA.text: Perfect place toHave legit English lunch! It's not a chain so it's a really nice place to have mash and sausages and pie AND pudding! Loved this place!!!

FDhdZgtvm2g4JG7gfSPbog.text: I didn't go here with a big expectation, but the mashed potatoes and meat pies went along beautify together and with the gravy too! The angus steak pie goes well with the farmers.gravy, but the traditional gravy is also great. As for the mash, would recommend the traditional Irish one with the cabbage

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

-2kyNLBDYJgZLdkm_-m0TA.text: This was one of the best places I ate while in London. It was summer, and we had to wait for the right moment to eat such a heavy meal. But once we did we wanted to go right back, despite being in the middle of SoHo with countless options around. The food is deceptionaly simple, incredibly delicious British comfort food. It's not the kind of stuff that appeals to a lot of the "clean-eating" (bleh) modern palate. But if you like things that are actually tasty at a really affordable price then this spot is worth a trip. The steak pie was better than the mince beef.The sticky toffee pudding was a little disappointing. It just wasn't sweet enough, which may be due to our sweets-loving American palates. I've had sticky toffee pudding stateside that was one of the best things I've ever eaten so I really had my hopes up for it. The custard in particular was very thin and bland so I'd skip dessert if I went again and I'm still giving the place 5 stars because the pies are worth it.

ZIuot0UXPJ6gLrEGCJ9SUw.text: Pretty bad service. I wanted to order and couldn't find the waitress. Finally spotted her eating behind the counter. We made eye contact but she continued eating then finished a glass of water before finally coming over.Food was what I expected. It's mash and pie - good comfort food and filling but nothing super special. Location is great, especially if you sit outside to watch people walking by.

1NsFdxfM8WNyyeAtDLFUrg.text: After visiting the British Museum, we walked down to Mother Mash to try some English pies and sausages. Once arriving we could see the restaurant was small, but luckily we didn't have to wait for an available table. We ordered the chicken pie with leeks and bacon paired with cheesy mash and farmers gravy. Our other main dish was the premium pork and London smokey sausages with classic mash and traditional gravy. It was really cold and snowing that night so eating the dishes felt so comforting. Both dishes were great but I think my favorite was probably the chicken pie. The sausages were great but the pie was slightly better tasting and paired so well with the mash and gravy we chose. Service was average, but that seemed as a result of one person was doing it all so she was really busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Premium pork and London smokey sausages with traditional mash and gravy and chicken, bacon and leek pie with cheddar mash and onion gravy

Que5DN3upuBAb_PqlKJAoQ.text: Food was five stars, service was three, so we meet in the middle.We were looking for a spot with yummy bangers and mash in London, and for that I highly recommend Mother Mash. It's a small storefront, but grab a seat outside to people-watch and enjoy the location. The menu is a three-step, allowing you to choose your mash, main and gravy.I ordered the champ mashed potatoes, Cumberland links and traditional gravy. I also got a side of buttered savoy cabbage because I couldn't decide between champ mash or Colcannon. It was incredibly difficult to decide as everything sounded delicious. I do wish they put a description on their sausages, because I personally don't know the difference between Cumberland, Oxford, Smithfield, etc. until I asked our server. The mash was buttery, smooth and perfect with the crunch of spring onions. The Cumberland links were snappy with a hint of garlic, and paired excellent with the traditional gravy. I even mixed in some of my cabbage with my dish. Yum!My partner ordered the horseradish mash, Aberdeen steak pie (they do have vegetarian options), and Farmer's gravy. There was only a slight hint of horseradish (as big fans, we do wish it was a bit stronger), the pie flaky with tender, but slightly overcooked steak. The gravy though was to die for, with tangy red wine and smoky bacon flavors. Obviously do not come here if you aren't in the mood for something heavy, filling and comforting! I truly don't think you can go wrong with any combination.As far as service, we were sat then checked up upon, but when we weren't yet ready to order, it was about another 15 minutes until we were checked on again. The food came out quickly once we ordered, but the server forgot the side of cabbage I ordered, and didn't come back until we were almost done with our meal, when we had to ask for the side again.All in all, if you're looking for a flavorful and tasty bangers and mash, I do recommend! The ingredients taste high quality and full of flavor versus more traditional bangers and mash. Just know what to expect when it comes to service (as it seems a lot of other reviews comment on this as well). Can't complain about the price either!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Champ mash, Cumberland links and traditional gravy.
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Horseradish mash (comes with drizzle of horseradish cream sauce), Aberdeen steak pie and Farmer's gravy.
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Located in an awesome area! Recommend sitting outside.

TL_6RI4lnTwlqA5cxMr-Xw.text: This was the first restaurant we tried on our first day in London and I was very happy with the experience!  We wanted to try a British spot to start our week-long trip right.  Mother Mash was across my hotel so it was a quick walk over to the plaza.  There were no lines, thank goodness - though we did come in just a little before dinner.  The Food: I ordered the sweet potato mash with minced beef meat pie, topped with farmers gravy.  I was a little concerned with the outcome because I felt if things were left for me to create... I can't guarantee it'll be a good combo.  My dish turned out delicious!  My friend ordered champ mash with angus beef pie, topped with traditional gravy - it was also delicious.  I didn't know mashed potatoes and meat pies could be so beautifully plated.  The mashes were extremely tasty and flavorful.  The pies were flaky; they didn't skimp out on the meat imo.  The gravy had perfect consistency.  I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone visiting London. The prices were in a do-able price range if you're trying to eat on a budget (hard to do in London + eating out! lol)

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Champ mash, angus beef pie, traditional gravy
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Mash and meat pie
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Sweet potato mash with minced beef pie, farmers gravy

Tg9-5Ax8svXYaIsvzyjMOw.text: Absolutely fantastic from the service to the food. This place is a must stop while in London!!!Cheers

7EtdOnDkqJKLsCHPz4E1gg.text: I really, reeeally wanted to love this place but the service let me down and the food didn't make up for it. We had been doing some sightseeing and I was looking for a casual but nice spot with some good pie and sticky toffee pudding for my family to enjoy on our last day in London (it's London-I'm expecting some good stuff).The concept at Mother Mash is great- you pick your mash, pie/sausage, and gravy. The prices are reasonable and it's in a great area. While the food was pretty good, the poor service really let me down. We had arrived an hour before closing and luckily they had a table open. Our waitress promptly took our order and when I asked if we should order our dessert now or later, she quickly said to wait and order it later. We didn't see her again until we left the restaurant (like seriously didn't see her-this spot is small and you can see everyone in the dining area); someone else dropped off our food, and then someone else came by to ask if we wanted to order anymore drinks before the check. When I asked if we could order dessert, the waitress informed me they were no longer taking food orders because the kitchen had closed. As a huge dessert fan, I was irritated to say the least. Considering how small this place is, how did we not see our waitress again and why tell me not to order dessert if you're going to ignore us for the rest of the evening?! She magically appeared as we were walking out and rest assured she got some side eye from me.There were a ton of great looking restaurants in the area so I probably won't be giving Mother Mash another shot.

ZhHkWcrwRBm266mlfnGzQg.text: So many options for the mash, the pies were great, we loved everything! Excellent service the staff was all very friendly,

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. So many choices! Each was amazing.

a2ZUVK7sT0RLY5ccmKR7Vw.text: BOMB! Wish I was is London longer just to eat here again! Bangers and mash, beer, and the desert all a must have. We did not have a reservation but we were lucky to get a seat. If your more then a party of two I would suggest making a reservation to make sure you don't miss out.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

1c4rELJmdGF_77g5Wa9b5A.text: A total hole in the wall -- but you can't miss getting bangers and mash when you visit London.The menu was very simple. Pick a type of sausage, mashed potatoes and gravy. Easy. I got the traditional sausage, mustard mash and farmer's gravy. Boy, oh boy, get a London Pride beer for this meal and you're good to go. Def stop when you're in London. I would definitely try all the other sausages and mash on the menu. 5*!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Pork sausage. Mustard mash. Farmers gravy.

mmI1wfIPyEqhRjfvlQiQig.text: Best bangers and mash and a great price!! Pick from your choice of mash, choice of different  sausage and/or pie & choice of gravy. Had bubbles and squeak mash, steak & ale pie w traditional? gravy! And had loaded mash, lamb & mint sausage and smoked sausage w traditional?  gravy. (Can't remember damn name of gravy) but it was delicious! And couldn't eat it all for less than 12 pounds a piece! Had great red berries cider and Hells beer. Great service and nice waitresses that didn't treat us like stupid Americans when we tried to pay with euros! Lol! Would absolutely recommend! And would love to go back for sticky toffee pudding (we were too full to even try) but another table had it and it was huge!! Wish we were staying in London longer but next time we will definitely eat there again!!! Thanks for the great food and service on our first night ever in London!!

YbAslZV6uZIF3c9RSEMYtw.text: Great chicken pie!! Cute restaurant in an area where there are lots of shops and restaurants. You have to try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Chicken pie and mash potatoes with gravy

yN-5BuKkmOyWnH_Pcc3q7A.text: It was ok.  The sausages were not crispy on the outside and everything was pretty bland.  That was my impression of a lot of London food though.  Servers were hard to flag down.

zHhb59SAy5M-IwgRSDW7bg.text: Thank you Yelpers for helping me find this delicious spot during a recent trip to London.  I knew I wanted some traditional meat pies on this trip, but what I got at Mother Mash was everything else instead! We had a late lunch and were seated right away at a outside small table. The menu is simple with either mash and sausages or mash with pie.  I went with the angus steak pie with the champ mash.  We also shared a side of bacon wrapped beans and butter cabbage.  The mash with cheese and spring onion was THE most delicious mash potato I never had!! It was a big serving with a ton of traditional gravy, which I'm glad so I didn't have to fight that much with my husband!  The two sides we got were also very tasty! I would have to say the meat pie was not how I would like, I think something with their crust is not as flaky.  I remember having better pies on a previous London trip.  I would have to say Mother Mash is THE mother of all mash definitely!

n5tfFB_2hIJtz8Kv8rjNmQ.text: Omg my must stop every time I'm in London. Pie and mash to die for!! Pies are flakey and hearty. Fillings are super yummy. And the mash is delectable.

8pQPJjoeipmU0SIvNgzX6g.text: I really enjoyed this place. We went to Carnaby Street for a recent promotional event where many stores and restaurants offered 20% off the entire night. After being unsuccessful on the clothes shopping front, we decided to get some food.The restaurant is quite small so you might have to wait a while for a table. Fortunately, the employees there are really nice and willing to do some creative things to get people seated. He noticed one table of folks were lingering after they finished their meal but didn't want to be rude by just kicking them out. So he offered to give them all a free glass of wine if they were willing to sit outside instead! Pretty cool.I got the colcannon mash with the chicken, ham and leek pie and farmer's gravy. So delicious! Usually, I don't expect much of the "mash" part of the dish but the colcannon was really good and almost outshined the pie. The pie itself was also very good. The mushy peas were not the most interesting I've ever had but they weren't bad either.They only have bottled beer, which I guess should be expected from a place like this but you don't come here for the beer so that's fine.Prices are very good considering the quality and location of the restaurant -- great casual place to go out with a small group of friends (not good for larger groups).

-3liY4p01gb1vpIG7wAoFA.text: I was with a couple of friends around Carnaby Street on the way to a party and looking for somewhere to get a quick bite to eat. We had thought to go to Cha Cha Moon but the queue was too long so we popped into Mother Mash.The restaurant/cafe is pleasant inside with several wooden booth style seats. My friends and I sat in a booth in a nook by the back. The concept is various simple with varieties of sausage, mash and gravy (as in Li-Mei H's review) to choose from. My friends and I all chose different combinations which were brought quickly. The food was nice and definitely comforting, though not particularly memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

zpDLI5kbFCBNPgb3B7ahKg.text: Nice quiet place off of Regent street.  Great pies and mash, I enjoyed the champ mash and steak and ale pie.  I prefer my mash, bashed for a little more texture.

39FD_QO_v9_h6Ckn3KhX6w.text: I was surprised by Mother Mash, it was far better than I expected but I don't know if I'd go again. In a desperate bid for a place to sit and drink in Soho on a Friday night (what were we thinking) my friend and I ended up eating at Mother Mash as it was the only place left with vacant outside tables.The pie wasn't great (lamb and rosemary), it was under seasoned and the meat a little tough, but the mash (champ) and traditional gravy were great, especially when you consider we spent about £9 each in central London.The service was a bit abrupt and despite having few other customers the waitresses really didn't want us to hang around to have another beer.

EiKHnxWHZ756Z_SVgH_qnw.text: On my most recent trip to London, I'd been wandering the Soho and surrounding area doing some shopping, and pulled up Yelp to get some options for dinner.   It's difficult to find a "British" place in the list, and while a local had suggested TexMex, I knew I wasn't going to come FROM the states to have TexMex.I found Mother Mash on the list, and decided to give it a whirl.   Traveling alone, especially eating alone, is usually a bit of a "get in, get out" type of experience.   Mother Mash actually fit the bill perfectly.This is a small little place tucked away off Carnaby, and at first I thought it was closed it was so quiet.  Nope, just not the "place to be" on a Saturday night at 8:00pm.   I wasn't alone in the restaurant, but by the time I had pudding I was.No matter.   The menu, described by some as difficult, isn't -- it's just they really do only two things.  Sausages and Pies.    I had the special of Steak and Ale pie, mixed with Classic Mash and a Mixed Salad on the side... and Traditional Gravy.  Yum!  Delicious food and delivered quickly, it presents those perfect Brit items very well.    The gravy was thick and delicious without being "too thick" and the mash was solid.    I finished off with the pudding, and while they were out of chocolate, the toffee pudding was delicious.   The service was with a smile, and I think they were surprised to actually be tipped.   (Despite what the culture is, I apply American rules.  Good service still gets you a tip... a 15% one on good service, thank you very much).Worth trying.   The pie was great, and the pudding more so.

nwxA4mNpxQhO2pcWC2ZOgg.text: If you generally enjoy sausage and mash when you go to the pub, then stop reading and just come to Mother Mash. If you are still reading I guess I need to tell you how good the food is at this place. I have been there quite a few times and always try something new....and I'm always very happy with my choice. Portions are just the right size, not too small not to big and a beer compliments the dish very well.  It goes without saying that you have the widest and tastiest sausages, mash and gravy in London but also the staff are nice and service is quick. On my last visit I took one of my work colleagues from the Luxembourg office and we had very little time before his flight....in and out in25 mins with 2 telephone conversations that interrupted our meal. He obviously loved it and the fact that it looks like diner/café did not put him off at all. It's a great value for money and price wise not much different than McDonalds...so get in there!

Q8V4Jh6FZeoi3Yjb2c-6Hw.text: Turned us away at 4pm saying they were closed on a non holiday Tuesday while customers were in the dining area.

xQpZwcsi0vSx05T8vfS5XA.text: Really tasty, both the sausages and the mashed potatoes and the gravy. Love the idea of having a place that focuses on that, and does it very well! Lots of options. I enjoyed the tables towards the end, too, and some of the paintings they have in that area.

rY367m8xmuTF7zeKAQpB-g.text: Americans often hear about how disgusting English food is but I finally gave the bangers and mash thing a try in authentic London. The concept here is simple: pick a mashed potato, sausage or a pie,  and a gravy. I had the Lincolnshire sausage and the mustard mash and onion gravy. Pure delight, highly recommended.

ooAgMDw9n8gsKnbbpPXgwA.text: Great Soho stop for sausage or pie and mash with gravy.  Enjoyed the lamb+mint sausage with mustard and cheese mash!  Save room for the pudding.  Tried the gingerbread with vanilla ice cream.  Fantastic!The booth in the back was a bit snug, but the hostess was very hospitable and the service very attentive.

ezLS3vHCcj3bZDRZFwW_Zg.text: My friend and I were bent on trying bangers and mash before we left London, so we turned to Yelp and found this place. We decided to come here during a late night study break, but contrary to the Yelp description, Mother Mash does not open until midnight (at least not on Sundays). We went back the next day and found it completely empty around lunch time. The menu is fairly simple: for something around £7, depending on whether you take out or eat in, you can choose your mash, gravy, and sausage (or pie for an extra £1). I got the cheesy mash, farmer's gravy, and pork and leek sausage. The portions are generous, and the food is really good. I loved my sausage, but the gravy was a little bit too sweet and not quite suited to my sausage and mash. Something about the consistency of the mashed potatoes was weird, too, but I've noticed it a lot in London, so maybe the Brits just make it differently.Anyway, cute place, pretty good food. Don't think I'll go back, but that's probably more because I'm not really a bangers and mash kind of girl.

TF1AUfgncSgvBdKWHu_83w.text: Good quality & tasty comfort food! Decided to drop via here to refuel after a busy shopping day & wasn't disappointed - really yummy food, friendly staff, & reasonably priced.Specializing in simple, homely food with a straight forward menu, you have a choice of pie or sausages with mash potato & gravy. I found the ordering system refreshingly to the point: you choose your mash, you choose your meat, & you choose your gravy, and then you get exactly what you ordered!I had the champ mash (butter, cheese & spring onions) with cumberland sausages & traditional gravy, and it was delicious!At £8 pounds for the meal it was reasonably priced, & I felt free to order a glass if plonk with the meal too; as well, that bill didn't come with a service fee attached to it -which I hate- so I didn't mind leaving my change for a tip.Admittedly the seating wasn't the most comfortably inducing to settle in for a prolonged period if time, but over-all I had a great experience dining here, & will definitely keep this litte gem in mind for next time I need an Oxford St recharge.

QmThNYz1Fd-cHFJu8xh-5A.text: I LOVED this place!  It's so cute, tucked away off trendy Carnaby street.  I ordered the veggie pie with mash and it was totally worth the food coma I had later!  On such a rainy dreary day, this was exactly what I needed, like a warm hug for my stomach. Every once in a while I crave Mother Mash something awful, you simply cannot get veggie pies (or veggie anything) in the US!

rHJ_eHR1lxlvGc4yjCQPhA.text: Yum!  Delicious!   I had the vegetarian sausages with the cheddar mashed potatoes and vegetarian grazy.  It was divine.   Everything tasted fresh and homemade.  My friends eat meat and tried the meat sausages and were even more impressed than I was.  We really enjoyed our meal here (though portions were a bit on the smaller side) and would eagerly go back.  The only downside is that the restaurant is quite small.  We went in the late afternoon and there was a wait for a table.  I imagine it'd get quite crowded at lunchtime.  Overall, though, I was impressed.

GxrttTwHh0mqKrCsw3iJnQ.text: Service: Great and very welcoming. Michaela helped us and was very personable. Food: It's bangers and mash...simple comfort food that will give you food coma later. Just don't come here if you're worried about counting calories. I had the Champ Mash, 3 sausages (lamb & mint, pork & leek, sweet Irish) and the Farmer's Gravy. Mash was really creamy and smooth, sausages were cooked well and went great with the gravy. Would definitely come here again for a sausage and mash fixin. In fact, anytime I visit London, I'll be sure to stop by here again. Ambiance - no complaints here. It's a fun, social setting. Come here and grab a quick bite before you continue your shopping adventures on Carnaby St.

mNgUPiQXu9uusGN1W8EKxQ.text: Nothing says 'comfort food' like a good old fashioned sausages. This place is great and even though I don't eat pork their veggie sausage was pretty good.I felt a little bit rushed here which wasn't actually that bad as it was lunch break. They do take-away too which will definately be trying while its still cold weather. I also think its a good place for people to dine on their own as it is quick and there is a bench you can sit on rather than the uncomfortable situation of taking up a table for four on your own!

uCISSVBKdnoL7aEjC9RfqA.text: This is one of my must stop locations when I travel to London. It is a small place down off Carnaby Street. I have been here about 6 times and the service is quick and friendly. The choice of food is simple but very good. They have lots of different sausages and meat pies. They have a special sausage and pie each day that isn't always on the menu. It is pretty simple system. You pick if you want sausages or a pie. You get 2 sausages or 1 pie with your order. You then pick which sausages or pie you want.. Then you pick which mashed potato you want. Followed by which gravy.I am a big fan of the Cumberland, Beef and Guinness, and Beef and Bacon sausages. The Steak and cheddar pie is very tasty as well. The cheesy mash is my personal choice. Nice amount of mature cheddar and mash mixed in there. The traditional gravy is very tasty as well. The food is fresh and hot and if you can get a table outside it is a great spot to people watch since it is in such a busy shopping area. I would recommend trying this place out if you want a good dose of traditional English comfort food.

GvNqFCLTFCKI8AuXewCYgA.text: A great, quick, cheap eat in central London. Lincolnshire sausages over Irish mash and farmer's gravy was delicious!

zRfhFd6pZwnMZXHyTfMNQw.text: This place is tucked away off Carnaby Street. It's a small, narrow space with sparse seating options - although they have a downstairs area that I only found out about after looking for the toilet.The pies are seriously scrumptious. I came here with my mother on a rainy day, and the mashed potatoes/pie combination warmed our hearts... and our stomachs.And the gravy! Duuuuude, the gravy was like liquid crack. Sooo good! Service was quick and friendly. The waitress didn't bother us much, which I liked, but with such a small place it's not like she could come and hang around anyway.Simple menu. Fantastic food. I love Mother Mash!

l3vQKWI2qSeidf3cfJcW5A.text: Yes, it is possible to get cheaper pie and mash in Central London. And yes, they sometimes overdo it with the gravy. And if I was a die-hard vegetarian, I might have cause to complain about the non-meat options as well. But with all that in mind, I still enjoy going to MM. I like the dinky wooden booths you sit in, and the funky artwork on the walls, and the no-fuss menu that gets straight to the point. Pick your mash, pie, gravy, and you're done. The food is always filling and tasty, and virtually guaranteed to give you the warm fuzzies before you leave the premises. Also, the staff are very considerate. Went at lunchtime with friends, but hadn't thought to book beforehand. We had to make do and sit outside in the chilly spring weather, but the waitress was kind enough to move us back inside once a table became available. Now that's the kind of service I like!

ck6uuef5l71Ly53LFXfT3w.text: This was such a great and unexpected find for our family. Streetside location in SoHo made for nice people watching. Kids loved the idea of a whole meal of just sausage and mashed potatoes, but the creativity and effort behind the dishes kept us (the adults) satisfied and impressed too. Well done, highly recommended!

_A_fhYqsJZ59g_5_p9b05w.text: British comfort food, served without a lot of fanfare, but has become a semi regular stop for me when visiting this area of London. I typically get the Lamb and Mint sausages and vary the mash.  You can't go wrong.

ccWk4KtypOqf4LwxIe_drg.text: I have a hard time giving a 5 star but the food and service is excellent. The type of food is simple not gourmet, but still earns the stars. I ordered the Champ mash with smokey sausage and mushy peas. All in for British food. It was as good as it could be. I will be back to try others.

Gllcmxy4xIwBA_DYInq6mA.text: Found this place on yelp, also looked on trip advisor.Loved the meat pies and mash!Quick friendly service, reasonably priced, near Carnaby street and the west End Theater district.Highly recommend this place!

oYaudE1WUJkrHAeGEX3rGg.text: Service was super nice & friendly & quick.  Food was so so good!! Especially loved the cheesy mash! Steak pie was cooked perfectly & seasoned delicious! Great spot to chill & people watch too!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Angus steak pie w/yummy cheesy mash

dM0sHxcT0UuhAjxl2C5QyA.text: Delicious food. They have a simple 3 step method to the menu by picking out your potatoes, your meat and your sauce. The food came out quickly and was very hearty, definitely a good place to stop and fill up. I got the angus steak meat pie which was amazing.

3AuPDptiCZj2aG-otsaWQQ.text: Had to get another pot pie since it was my last day in London and I was extremely excited after having my first pot pie for lunch. This was double the price and double the disappointment. I ordered the veggie pot pie with liquor gravy and cheesy mustard mash. I love that they let you customize your order but the quality isn't up to par. The pie was dry and bland. The mash was not cheesy - just a strong mustard taste. As for the gravy, it gave the pie an off taste so I mixed it with the mash.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Liquor gravy
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Cheesy mustard mash with veggie pot pie
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

y2Xg-WM-K0EmcsmUtrbxuA.text: Awesome food, great atmosphere. Perfect spot to load up on hearty food and feel like you're not a tourist after exploring London all day.

yM9vjusYYHpiGhLqjjrZzA.text: After reading some good reviews on this sausage and mash restaurant. I went there to experience myself ...the reviews was absolutely right...it was very tasty and delicious. The menu come with different choice of mash, sausages and gravy sauce. Try to avoid lunch time to go there as it is always busy. Also they do take away for those who work at surrounding area. A lovely traditional British restaurant  and reasonable price. I would go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

yX7J4ylCOYXCD5R0DVtAfg.text: I got the champ mashed potatoes with the angus beef pie. The mash was super soft and the pie was delicious. Great simple food done well.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Champ mash with angus steak pie and traditional gravy.

dLVojVYqtJdD1OKsGdDzUA.text: Went here for a friends farewell! They do fab pies, really fresh and delicious! However wouldn't recommend this place for a big group of people as there is limited seating space. Great food though!

CmWoEjUpAoy_zdgV41KaBg.text: My favorite pie shop in London.It's extremely fast, and the food is great, especially during cold British days (most of the year).I recommend the Lamb Hot Pot pie with Bubble Squeak.

E-xXiaa5XyDe3e27nTqKnQ.text: A very nice, cosy little place for lunch/dinner. They have a bunch of different types of mash. We tried the Champ, Colcannon and Cheesy mustard. They were all pretty good, though the cheesy mustard is probably an acquired taste. The spring onions in the Champ were a bit undercooked as well for people who dislike raw onions. Our favorite was definitely the Colcannon. For the mains, I would definitely recommend the pies over the sausages. Their pie crusts are delicious. We also tried their ginger beer, which was awesome! (Though the ginger taste is pretty strong, so it may not be everyone's favorite)

0l2SeLZKGGhHlTZwB4iVKw.text: Meat pie worth dying for, and gravy that I tbh would swim in. Service was fairly solid with an exception that we were told we'd only have an hour to eat (which is more than enough) due to a large party arriving soon.

5Ip4MStcZ3dzvrtDb5PcCA.text: We went here based on the reviews and were not disappointed!  We ordered four different variations of the mashers and all were amazing.  Great for kids who like mashed potatoes and stuff.  The Farmer's Gravy was out of this world.  The special was Beef and Guinness Sausage...outstanding.  The pie crusts were soft and flaky.  The Bubble and Squeak Mash was the best mash of the ones we tried.  The champ had a lot of potential, but we disliked that the spring onions weren't sautéed before being added to the mash (minor).  The sticky toffee pudding was light and spongy...perfect!

_RLaEF66VjqWmGZbIEkiHA.text: If this place opened up in Los Angeles, it would have a line out the door.  Incredible, delicious food.  Quick service and reasonable price.  What more could you ask for!  I just read Kaitlyn B.'s 2 star review.  I was there right about the same time.  I can't imagine what the problem was.  I went out of my way to talk to the owner and tell him how much my family enjoyed the hot, yummy food on a cold London day in December.  You won't be disappointed if you want some authentic English meat pies.

1dtMyUmEs-HwTqNMmZLTWw.text: Before I go to London I decided to search for some restaurants that served British food. Mother Mash showed up and the pictures looked amazing. Once I got to London I looked for this restaurant and despite it being far from my hotel, I made there an hour before they close.  I ordered the steak pie with Irish mash and farmers gravy. Oh my god!! It was sooo delicious that I couldn't help but to order again the lamb sausage with mint and the same mash and gravy. I just wish I had more time in London so I could try more items on the menu of this restaurant but everything I had were excellent with very reasonable prices.

X77I_Cw5uyR6szLlQNt7aw.text: The food was good and the price was nice for London. Having options on what type of mash, bangers, meat pie and gravy is great.  The location maybe a little busy but don't let it fool you, inside is a relaxed atmosphere and helpful staff.

EtpeSts5iVbjelw9xb28fg.text: We were in Covent Garden and I wanted some comfort food.....looked up yelp and with the positive reviews of Mother Mash and was not disappointed.It's more of a revised sausages/mash/meat pie place, so with that in mind I ordered the Chicken, Leek and Bacon Mash with mustard and Farmers Gravy (red wine and mushroom reduction). Pie crust was flaky and I could taste the mustard in the mash. Farmers gravy made it a rich and delicious dish. It was finished with London Pride beer and hit the spot on a gray and cold day. Service was efficient, toilet was one of the smallest I've ever been in (even for a fun sized person like me), but it was clean so I'm not complaining.

DqqewD1nhVqrBKLjO4Epug.text: Really enjoyed this restaurant! Reasonably priced and staff is very welcoming! You get to choose your mash, meat and gravy so it's cooked exactly to your taste. They seem to have tour groups around 5 so either come early or call ahead to make sure there is space. Would come back again if we were in London longer!

w6uDkaNX94-LqmK2WZAN2g.text: Saw this little place on Kyde and Eric's London visit video and it looked so good I wanted to give it a try.  I came by around noon on a weekday and they weren't open yet, so I waited around a bit and they opened at 12:30.  I sat outside and ordered from a very friendly waitress.  I had the Colcannon mash with the Mediterranean Pie (veggie) and the veggie gravy.  Everything was just lovely and what I expected, except for the mash, it was under-seasoned.  A cute location to stop in for some authentic British fare if you happen to be in the Carnaby area.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

NyGTNK8Hf4ErHq1BIbxFLw.text: Ganton street is so cool at night. This place hit the spot after a long day of walking. Great comfort food. Good service. Went with the smoked sausages and Irish mash. Very good! You choose a mash, a sausage (or a pie), and a gravy. Lots of great options to choose from a doubt you will be unhappy with your choices.

_4r4fUzPxCk59zbDyNTDIQ.text: Food here is incredible! Cheesy Mustard + Steak Pie + Farmers Gravy FTW!Was my first stop after 10+ hours of travel from the US.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Cheesy Mustard + Steak Pie + Farmers Gravy

TchiLHzVEPgBOshX7Nolgw.text: Honestly, I was so jet-lagged arriving at Mother Mash that all I remember is that our meals were fantastic, the atmosphere on the patio was great and the service was superb. We got our food super quickly and it was just what we were hoping for - a good rib-sticking meal. Hard to go wrong with a classic pie and mash!

wUP4FrYFOfTtHc37XJtDsQ.text: Really good and affordable pies with mash (aka mashed potatoes). They've got a good selection of fillings (chicken and leek, steak and kidney, lamb - a daily special so not always available, etc) as well as different mashes. I noticed some reviewers complaining about there being too much gravy and since I'm usually not a huge gravy fan, I asked for it on the side which they kindly obliged. However, I really didn't need to have the gravy on the side because I basically used it all up because it was amazing! I mean the whole meal was great (took just a little bit to go because I was stuffed) and definitely a good place to check out if you want some good ole British pies and mash while staying in central London.Also of note, I made a reservation via OpenTable for 5 PM on a Friday night and there wasn't any line but I've heard there can be a queue so to be on the safe side, make a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Gravy on the side - ask for this if you're worried about too much gravy!

JCisHA2yKE6X_0NYObC6Aw.text: This place is amazing! My husband and I spent almost two weeks in the UK, and out of all of the restaurants we went to, this was our favorite. The location is great, with lights above in the alley. There is seating outside and inside. We chose to sit inside. We were greeted immediately by friendly servers, and given menus. Our orders were taken quickly, and the food was brought out in a short time. I ordered bubble and squeak mash, the cumberland sausage, and onion gravy. My husband ordered the champ mash, cumberland sausage, and traditional gravy. Both plates were brilliant! The mash was flavorful, perfect consistency, and beautiful. The sausages amazing. The gravy was incredible, also perfect in every way. We ordered a fruit pie to share, and that was fantastic as well. If we lived in London, we would definitely return to this place frequently!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Bubble and Squeak mash, cumberland sausage, and onion gravy.
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Apple pie with ice cream.

xH8qj5Y3cyQnZEr4FxTj2w.text: I really wanted to try some good bangers and mash while I was in London. A Yelp search showed me Mother Mash. So my friends and I decided to make our way over one night after a tourist-filled day of sightseeing.We were able to make a reservation through Open Table for a Thursday night at 9. When we arrived, it was still a packed house. Luckily, we didn't have to wait, which was good. On the negative side, our waitress really looked like she would rather be doing anything else in the world than serving us peasants. Despite this, our food and drinks still came out in a timely manner. I ordered the Cheesy Mash with Cumberland sausage. I really couldn't tell if these were good or not due to the gravy it was smothered in. Each of my three friends ordered a different mash/pie, which all came smothered in the same gravy. Maybe this is a British thing, but it made the dish super heavy. Plus, they all ended up tasting the same.Not sure where all of these great reviews are coming from...

oW7COAssgYw0XHQxWqF7LQ.text: This place is small, but it fills up quickly.  One con:  the place is very understaffed.  It took a long time to get food, water, and the check.  *** One star for service. We were in there for like, an hour when we really wanted to be there for 30min. Mostly waiting. The wait for food was so long that more than one set of people got up and left. Food, however, is great. There are a few steps:1. Choose the type of mashed potatoes2. Choose either a sausage or a pie (there are a few vegetarian pie options but no vegetarian sausage options)3. Choose the gravy (again, there is a vegetarian option)Everything tasted wonderful.  Sticky toffee was not bad, but I think the mash, pie, and gravy was better.  Yum.

ZXZV7EBhu-7Q49kBh2Ivjg.text: It was amazing and the sauce was very Taiwanese. The place was very good when you are tired on shopping in Regent street.

aBLqz2H3wJ2YoOoI_Prd3g.text: Your getting into mash heaven here.It's a three step process with over twenty two options to choose from just an insane variety of mash & sausage combinations.I went with the creamy horseradish mash and vegetable herb sausage because I'm about the vegan sausage.Mash with sides of old school English mushy peas and pan fried french beans sauteed in garlic and parsley were spot on!I met the owner Eward he said it's conceptually created after the food the workers used to eat on the docks back in the day and your in Carnaby where the Beatles bought their clothes and designers like Vivienne Westwood set the tone.Go down at night it's in a bustling area with all kinds of things to do before you take a seat.
