Very tasty and succulent chicken pie with silky, buttery mash and a pool of the most flavoursome gravy. My soul was definitely satiated. Thoroughly recommend, plus service on this occasion was lovely.

Gn_CiFdQUNzs9rSQf8o-tw.text: Small place, great food, nice staff. Come early or make a reservation, the few tables fill up very quickly

QMVJOk0CesogcU7S_DEWMw.text: So in London you eat bangers and mash, right?We took a causal stroll thru SOHO and we stumbled in to this amazing place, staff was wonderful. Food was out of this world. The waiter heard us talking and ask where we were from, we finished the night listening to the beach boys and talking about Southern California with him and made us feel right at home.

pgzTqRgIorcMm0_DpPd6ZA.text: As a tourist, I had to try authentic British cuisine. That is why I decided to try Mother Mash. I ordered the Bubble and Squeak mash, Chicken and Garlic sausages with traditional gravy. The sausages had a nice outer layer and nice flavors. The mash seemed to be fried since it had a nice crust on it, as well. But together, the flavors married in a very lovely way. The only reason I gave them 4 instead of 5 stars is because they Card reader wasn't working and I had to fine a cash machine.

tVE5ceLdubght0rmOpXCFg.text: First time in London so I didn't know what to expect from mash and pie. Absolutely delicious! Got the cheesy mash, steak pie and onion gravy

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

j5jngv8RR5WwWY9R6XachQ.text: On the recommendation of some Local Guides we decided to stop here for a quick bite before going out for the evening. All in all? If you want pie and mash then it's a pretty good place to come. (They also do sausages) I ordered the cheddar mash with the steak pie and the traditional gravy with a side of cauliflower cheese. The pie had quite a lot of filling (always a bonus), the gravy was tasty and the mash was really flavourful too. They do offer the option of 'smooth' or normal mashed potato. I went with smooth and do wish that I had gone with the other option as it was just a little too pureed for my liking. I didn't really rate the cauliflower cheese. In terms of decor and comfort, it is pretty much a fast food place and you're not going to spend a lot of time here but for a quick, filling bite on a cold evening? It's pretty good.

EFMAIlLqWYlt6yU4Yl9GYw.text: I had vegetarian pie with mash and gravy and toffee pudding. It was good but didn't really like the toffee pudding. I have eaten better pudding at places. The waitress messed up my order a little and hence the 4 stars.

LDMRwNMs0RD5XnqDuGEtrA.text: Friendly staff, delicious English pies. The Angus pie with traditional mash is yummy. You won't leave hungry!

M4Xks6W8pUOWF2jgA3EODw.text: Last April, I traveled to London with a group of about 32 people. This was the first spot  where we ate dinner. I was a bit apprehensive at first. I'd heard all the rumors about British food being awful. Mother Mash totally broke that stereotype! The restaurant is small, but they were able to host our entire group with two small tables to spare. Our food was brought out promptly.  They had a vegetarian meat pie for me! Yum! It was the perfect portion. The mash was smooth, comforting and paired well with the flaky "meat" pie. The gravy wasn't too salty but more than what I'd usually pour on my mashed potatoes. I really enjoyed my dinner at Mother Mash and I'm happy that our tour group took us to local places instead of the cookie cutter tour restaurants. You know I'll be back when I'm in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Veggie meat pie and mash. So good!

zczOU-OTI92pQ3B6RrqYDQ.text: Best meal ever! I loved my chicken pie and bubble & squeak mash with vegetable gravy and the chocolate pudding... I really wish I could go back now just to have it all again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. My most favorite meal ever.
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Best meal ever! Bubble and squeak potatoes with chicken bacon and leek pie with onion gravy and chocolate pudding with ice cream

VNXf7f5R3NopYUHtJk2sfg.text: In a really fun area of town, great, tasty and not expensive. The sweet potato mash was great....and the sticky toffee pudding!! Also, easy to go if you by yourself.

HooaUuU7VgSHbBTaa0ITbw.text: We saw a foodie show that featured this restaurant a month before we came to London and knew we wanted to try it. We ended up walking Five miles to get there and it was worth every step. We arrived around 12:00 noon and there was only one table open at the time. The service was friendly and efficient. We were happy for our servers menu suggestion. My husband and I both ordered the pies. My only regret is that there is no Mother Mash back home.

7QhCvc4QZESvDEDv-MJObg.text: Bangers and Mash.  Sounds interesting... until you see it, then you'll understand.  Hence the name, banger (sausage), meat pie, and some mash(-ed potatoes).  Pretty funny, ey?I have to say, most restaurants in London are pretty... quaint to say the least.  At all costs, the food here was phenomenal.  I decided to let go of my 'non red-meat eating' frenzy to enjoy some authentic London food!You choose your:1. Type of sausage.  I chose cumberland. Really good. You should do it.2. Type of pie.  I got chicken. 3. Type of gravy. Try the farmer's gravy... made with red wine & some pretty yummy veggies.4. Type of mashed potatoes. I ordered Irish.Together gets put into one bowl of amazingness. Everything all in all was pretty heavy to me, but nonetheless really comforting!  I had to share it with my cousin (he finished it all. I couldn't hang!)For dessert, I got the English Sticky Toffee Pudding with custard.  Guarantee, you'll feel like you died and gone to heaven with this place, if you don't pass out from food coma first.

01jCFaLNO-etFS4pVfcKKA.text: Nom nom nom, me love the bangers and mash, actually I had the pie, but I'll be honest, I just really wanted to write 'bangers'. Bang.Anyhoo, popped into Mother Mash for a pre-karaoke dinner. Thought it best to line the stomach with some serious stodge. The food was really good, nice portion size, not too massive, which was a relief. Pies and Sausages are there in full force and they taste a-ok.Wine was drinkable and ok for the price. Service was speedy and attentive. So no probs there.But alas, the seating was something pulled out of the deck of an Edwardian Steam Liner. Wooden and with only enough space for people of an average waist size. To our fuller friends you may want to give MM a miss to avoid the embarrassment of being unable to squeeze into the booths. Just sayin'Perfect for a pre-theatre bite to eat.

9togz6P9-KHX55U1lpoD7A.text: I had dinner at Mother Mash 3 times during my trip to London, and it was certainly the food highlight of my 10 day trip.To order, you must choose your mash (mashed potatoes), your meat (sausages or pie), and your gravy. I went with the cheese and mustard mash; chicken, ham & leek pie (I also tried some of the pork sausages, which were quite nice); and the farmer's gravy. My mouth is watering now thinking about it. For dessert you must try the toffee pudding with ice cream... pure heaven.

yIdBtq4MRkyDGgiK1oxX4g.text: Wandered in here very hungry, quite late, on a cold bank holiday evening, and were sat down eating simple, tasty grub in about 10 minutes! Totally non-pretentious, friendly service, and reasonably priced. Great stuff!

i6CzFHojTms4TuaUiAfY4w.text: Nice, easy menu for a group- pick your mash, pick sausages or pie, pick a gravy. Tasty, and generous portions. Four of us shared 3 meal plates, and 2 desserts and left well satisfied. The desserts were great- we had one sticky toffee pudding with custard, and one hot chocolate pudding with ice cream. Both were delicious, but our favourite was the toffee pudding in a sea of custard sauce.

4YCAagGBcbgC7sjOmNUiQQ.text: The meat in the pie is nice , but the pie dough is not very good ! The gravy was terrible !!. The plates looked beautiful but the taste was pretty bad

x6IRgQLl76uPSRnQv3NyCQ.text: A good basic sausage & mash place.  I had the Colcannon mash with a lamb & mint sausage and a pork & leek sausage (meal comes with 2) with traditional gravy.  Was a bit surprised to find half the plate swimming in the gravy, but the pork & leek sausage was v. tasty.  Mash was smooth and comforting.  Would go back again if in area.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

XhFfjj0YOYqSAaUdrPwBiw.text: Had the chicken and mushroom pie with a cheesy mustard mash and a farmer's gravy. Was wonderful. So good I went back for my last meal in town the next day and had the chicken, leek, and bacon. It's a small shop, so not advisable for parties of more than 4 or so. Service was very good, and the food was wonderful. Will definitely go back.

kKh0J5rnqIFchz7nS_JtKQ.text: Mother Mash, wow, what a place. Literally just went there for lunch with my colleagues and I am stuffed full of yummy yummy mash and sausages. We went early around 12.30, because it gets really busy and managed to bag a tiny little booth, where we all squished in. You can choose what type of mash to have for instance: Classic, Champ, Cheese and what type of sausages (two per serving): Pork & Leek, Beef & Ale, Lincolnshire, Lamb & Mint and what type of gravy: Classic, Onion Gravy, Farmers Gravy. You can also have extra sausages (£1.60 each) or a side of mushy peas, garden peas, caramelised onions for £1.50. Bear in mind, this menu is the condensed version off the top of my head!We all ordered sausages and mash, though we can get it to take-away and you get salads too. And the food was cleaned off our plates within 10 mins. The food was really really good, though service was a bit odd, as we were seated really quickly but then it took a while for someone to come over and take orders for drinks and food, then when Martin asked for the dessert menu but Nico asked for the bill, we got the bill quicker than the dessert menu. But it was the lunch hour so it's forgivable. You should come here when you want a good hearty warm meal to fill you up and if it's raining outside, even better as they have a skylight at the back so you can see the rain but be cosy inside with yummy food in your stomach.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

eGjOcLMiHT4DwXkJJaWIFw.text: Me and my wife ate here last week while we were on vacation in London. We both enjoyed our meal and would recommend this place to anyone looking to enjoy some bangers and mash. We both ordered something different so we could try the different types of mash, gravy, and sausage and each to be unique and delicious.

GU_pzmYrOrp6vXC2NMSqoQ.text: enjoyed a great dinner of mash and chicken pie, farmers gravy. It was good and served hot (tough in a large group).  The service was good, fast, friendly and efficient. I felt bad for the waitresses, running up and down the stairs; to and from the kitchen.Would definitely recommend this restaurant and visit again the next time I am in London. Fun area with lots of great shops and pubs!

4LpJagJ2R8qU7511acct7g.text: Reasonably priced for the area, Mother Moo offers up pretty tasty (but not phenomenal) sausage, pies...and, you guessed it, mash. There's a variety of each to choose from, and plates start at around £8 (you can add extra sausages for £1 each). Service is quick and friendly.

cy58dkn4ho4p7WBhPaXrfQ.text: Nice little place right off of Carnaby Street. I came here with a co-worker at 1:30pm on a Friday once and it was PACKED. We were in the takeaway line and had to wait 20 minutes just to order, but our food came out very very quickly.I ordered the horseradish mash and steak and ale pie - it was way too much mash for me (oof I feel my stomach expanding as I type this) but the pie was delish - flaky pastry that went perfectly with the mash! The staff are nice - there was one guy there preparing all the food in front of us and he was swamped with orders but he was still really polite and charming which I appreciate a lot.I would definitely love to come back here for dinner or something - not sure lunch is the best idea as it will absolutely without a doubt leave you in a food coma, meaning nothing will get done for the rest of the day...

317ZEWDzMR5oFWOhP4jhBg.text: So... Here are my thoughts on my meal here tonight.... Mmmmmmm... Mmmmmmmmmmm.....mmmmmmm....cozy....mmmmmm....comfort....... Mmmmmm wanted a nap after......mmmmmmmm it is what it is and if you are looking for salad or a burger, don't go here. It is mashed potatoes and gravy.  And it is damn good !

qLUKNsQC7_4uNz7qR7_rfw.text: Came here on yelp recommendation but food did not meet expectation. We moved tables to accommodate a bigger table but that seemed to throw off the service and our order disappeared until we mentioned it 30+ minutes later. They were very apologetic and comped cokes.The mash was great but the chicken in the pie and lamb sausage was dry. Still a reasonable price for what you got. Would give it a second chance.

HzLu8O4DoBEGWTOQpkYQOw.text: Mother Mash is the mother of comfort food restaurants- the perfect venue for the increasingly cold winter days. I have never really been a fan of mash (probably because of the lumpy variety served at school!) but this place has converted me. The relaxed cafe style interior with wooden booth seats is ideal for enjoying classical British mash with either sausage or pies.It is a simple concept Mother Mash serve either mash and sausage for £6.95 or mash and pie for £7.95. There is a wide selection of mash including classic, cheesy and cheesy mustard. If none of those sound tempting you can actually create your own mash from a range of ingredients including olive oil, salad cream and pesto. There is also a good range of sausages, pies and even gravy. They serve alcohol although I've always been too tempted by the traditional lemonade and ginger beer.If you have room for dessert (I doubt it) try one of their old fashioned stodgy treats such as sticky toffee pudding and chocolate pudding. If you steer clear from carbohydrates Mother Mash would be hell but for me it's perfect for comforting carb heaven.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

2F82cTIoj2As9vP40JLiKA.text: Loved it.  It really hit the spot.  I tried the steak and ale pie, one pork and leek sausage, traditional gravy, a London beer, and the bill came to $13.90. It was very filling. The service was friendly. The place is small, very bare-bones.  Just 5 or so booths, no decor of any kind. I am American, so what do I know about pies? The only pies I know come frozen, and have the name "Swanson" on the box.  So with (almost) nothing to compare it to, I have to say I loved it, would recommend it, and would come back.

JQqIIlWiWmPvJppPa9vIpA.text: I love the concept of this place. Its a three step process. Pick your mash - pick your sausage/pie - pick your gravy. Everything was great, great sausage and great pies. The mushy peas were also excellent. Its quick and not expensive. It was like 7.95 - 8.95.

AhNWLpPZzfOnWhB5zMsK9g.text: So I arrive in London for a short business trip and have a craving for one of my British favorites - Bangers & Mash.  I turned to the Yelp community to help me and they delivered, as usual.  Mother Mash was perfect for what I was after - good, relatively inexpensive food in a relaxed setting.  The place is tiny, and if I wasn't paying attention as I passed, I may have missed it.  It wasn't very crowded on a Saturday around lunch time, so I didn't have to wait for a table, which was nice.  I could see how the place could fill up quickly however, given its small size.You have three choices:  Choose your mash (plain, cheesy, with onions,etc), choose your pie or sausage (they have several of both, and you can mix your sausage order), choose your gravy (again, several choices).  I might be in heaven.  Though not for me, I also respect the fact that they have a vegetarian option, which would help those of us who regularly dine with an herbivore to convince them to join us!The food came out fast, it was delicious, and I walked away satisfied.  Mother Mash will go on my list of places to visit the next time I'm in town for sure.

0_LCAFaDeO15EHmtl2hTRg.text: Fantastic combos to deliver whatever flavor you want.  Go from traditional to German to whatever.  Only downside was no draught beer.  Pro tip- get the cheesy cauliflower

avN9SztfT7pwiiv3UPeMUg.text: Delicious food! Service can be a little slow, but you're on holiday so who cares!  The outside space has a great vibe. I would suggest their Apple raspberry crumble!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Dessert: toffee chocolate and apple raspberry! Delicious

98I7fkfzB2NiZe49d1JGUw.text: This place is a must when in London!  I wanted to try a meat pie and mashed and this was absolutely amazing.  Quick and easy with a nice staff.  I'll be back!

TDPF4Rair6zul-g4VOnUpA.text: Nice servers, good but somewhat bland food.  Pretty much standard English food.

MmIsNHYZALst_NngU0_p7Q.text: I had the bubble and squeak, Angus pie and farmer's gravy. Really good. Seriously really good. Definitely coming back. Service is friendly and lightning fast.

N_4C56-bP0NChjwpWz91Sw.text: Sooooooo good! Sort of small but you go there for the food, not necessarily atmosphere. So many choices and combinations of mashed potatoes and meat pies. Healthy? God no. Delicious? Heck yes. A must visit.

xJWr-SQjqTE_PJbildOHkQ.text: Solid chose for meat pies and mashed!  Food comes out incredibly quickly and is priced well.  Beer selection is okay.  Felt like a fast food temp for dinner but food was very good.

TWqh6Gr27M9-X5byBWq19g.text: Good and simple. Choose your may, choose your meat and choose your sauce. It's cheap and affordable and it's filling. One your done, go next door to drink a pint. Cheers!

kBN5lzhWwFWv78ynhaX9PQ.text: I've been in London for about 3 days now and have seen/eaten a lot of different food. London, like my native home of Los Angeles, has a wide variety of diverse food from different cultures and countries.  However for whatever reason I've been having a hard time finding modern twist on traditional British food, so I was excited to stumble upon Mother Mash. This restaurant primarily offer sausages and pies and allows their patrons to choose from a variety of different kinds. You can also pick fun and unique selections of mash potatoes and gravy to accompany your meal.With that said...this place is solid and safe but the taste of the food is missing that X factor (no BBC pun intended) .... I wouldn't go out of my way to come here and to top it off they wouldn't serve me dessert because they were closing in 15 min.  Lame...

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

YScZpUtuTCp2UO2tfk5PSw.text: The epitome of 'I want something English to eat'. Simple menu. Good ingredients. Not ideal for people who don't like carbs or are vegetarian. But if you're either of those you can go get a sad salad from marks and Spencer because this place is not for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Mashhhh

mzslxmcqMD4Ze8vG1O6pFQ.text: Amazing. It's an eatery based off mashed potatoes and gravy, what else do you need to know? Flaky pie, cheap, cool location.

L75UtEyI8Gu2Tuo_1NlP1w.text: I wanted to like this place.  I wanted to like any place that features mashed potatoes.  But sadly, the mashed potatoes just weren't very good.  They were gelatinous and sticky and worst of all, devoid of any flavor.  They felt more like boxed mashed potatoes (blech!) than anything special.  I was very sadly disappointed.  The staff were all very nice.  The set up is like a fast-food establishment.  The prices were reasonable.  But the mashed potatoes just weren't very good.  I wish I could report otherwise.

3Pi3fQnqdYfmmN4pCE7uvw.text: My sister and I ate here our first night in London after some Yelp searching. We also came back a few days later for breakfast! We walked up and it was packed! Thankfully we snagged the last available table. My sister was very excited, because she's a vegetarian and they had many veggie options. The menu is is simple. You choose which mash you'd like, pie or sausage, and finally the gravy that will go with it. There are quite a few options for each category. I chose the traditional Irish mash, with a steak pie, and traditional gravy. My veggie sis got the cheese mash, butternut squash pie, and onion gravy. By the end we both wanted to lick our plates clean! The service was pretty great too, our waitress was very nice and attentive. Prices were also awesome! I had a cider and she had a juice plus our meals, and we spent less than $30 in total. Breakfast was super delicious. I had the traditional English breakfast and my sis had the veggie breakfast. Those mushrooms were the best thing ever! Thankfully my sis doesn't like mushrooms so I got eat hers too, muhaha. The little potato cake is so amazing. Really glad we had our traditional English b-fast experience here!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Traditional English breakfast! So delicious.
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. The veggie version  cheese mash, butternut squash pie, and onion gravy.
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. My Irish mash, steak pie, and traditional gravy.

DGSxeccN3WoD-6zlFPR3cw.text: I absolutely loved this place for meat pies. It was my favorite restaurant during my trip to London. I liked the selection they had. It was a nice experience choosing my pie/sausage, mash, and sauce. Everything was great and it was at a great price. You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Sausages with mash, additional meat pie, and mushy peas

gk5p5N159JFsOdCTYJdESQ.text: Decided that Pie and Mash needed to be on our "to do" list for this trip to London so we headed to Mother Mash.  I love the Carnaby Street area - such a lot of fun shops and restaurants - without the hoards of tourists.  My husband is gluten-free so he got bangers and mash.  Their sausages have oats but not flour so that's not an issue for him.  Do ask, though - one of their sauces is gluten-free but the rest aren't.  I had an Angus beef pie and mash.  It was good (it's British food so it's never really spectacular).  The mash (I choose colcannon) needed salt and I don't salt anything.  Service was good and it was a nice evening so we sat outside.  I love that you can choose your mash and your pie or sausage and then your sauce.  It was nice to customize your own dish.Updated: We went again with friends 12/17 and sat inside in the back of the place.  The tables back there were SO UNCOMFORTABLE.  The bench seats are too narrow to actually sit so you're sort of perched and trying not to slide off.  But, you're also high off the ground so your feet have to fight for space on a bar down the center of the table because they can't reach the floor.  We played "footsie" with our friends as we tried to brace ourselves to stay on the benches.  It really spoiled the experience.  We ate as fast as we could just to release ourselves from the torture of the bench.  I won't sit back there again.

0pr3756c4V-NhZS1ok8bRQ.text: Loved it! Found this place the first day of our trip to London and we could not have found a better place to grab a quick bite to eat. Bangers and mash and stereotypical British food. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

BS40HmX1sUKwDmbyCOjW6w.text: Established for 12 years +We just spent the past 8 days in London, 2 dinners, 2 lunches and 1 breakfast were had at Mother Mash! Euan, the owner is a super friendly bloke who looks after his customers as do the other staff who work here.As for the food, we wouldn't have eaten here so much if it weren't any good.The selection of Mash, Pies or Sausages and Gravies were to die for and there are a number of sides you can order to compliment your already fantastic meal. If you're up for the challenge order an extra pie or sausage! All suitable for the meatetarian or vegetarian.Deserts are sensational, had Apple Pie and Ice cream and partner had Apple Crumble and Custard.Best regards, Aussie travelers!

SonPlxLnZSICOemHpd3pLQ.text: So good!!! We got the last lamb pie and boy were we happy about that! This place was a definite highlight of our trip! Make reservations because it gets very full.

wcPEnV2eXEzOMrEOOGvKmQ.text: Since my hubby and I got to London, we were dying to try thing some local dishes, so we looked it up online which near us at that moment. Mother Mash showed up.  After we saw couple pics of this, we decided to give it a try. The restaurant actually located it at Soho district, yeah right, another place we wanted to visit. Checked! It took us couple turns we finally found the restaurant. Well, tell you a easier way to find it, when you pass the alley that which lots of light bulbs between the building then you know you are in the right place.The restaurant was smaller than I expected, but we came for the food anyway. We picked a seat outside, it didn't take long the waitress already with us. I was kind of new to this food. They also got a interesting was for ordering, basically you can DIY want you like to have on your dish, quite a fresh idea. I did ask the waitress she recommend me some stuff. I sort of forgot the name by now. It was something with premium sausages. Well, like I said, it was a DIY set. I really like how it tasted. It was really different and I like it a lot, I also ordered a Ginger beer, nice drink as well. My hubby also enjoyed his ordered as well, which it was good, usually he isn't a fan of British cuisine. The generally cost wasn't so high here as well and we like the location. The stuff were really friendly as well. If you're also looking for something local food to try out, this might be the place for this.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. I like the food and the beer.
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. A glance of the place.
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Nice decorated.

FTC8A9ZkkNVbYsEhr4xxlw.text: I must admit that my recent visit was actually my second visit to Mother Mash, which should be self-explanatory to why I'm giving it 5 stars. I understand that pies are absolutely considered a British Classic, and the pie-place to go to is Mother Mash. Not only is this place hilariously well priced (Central London, after all) but the pies are absolutely delicious, juicy, and tender. the mash potatoes are perfect (I highly recommend bubble and squeak), and the gravy is on point! I plan to visit this place at least once every time I go to London, and this past visit I actually ordered myself an extra pie to eat the next morning as breakfast (Sorry, I'm shameless).

-XFGMTYW43bM4EFnUo8FxA.text: Yummy! The food is simple and Yum (again) Worth the hike to it. Set in very festive SoHo. There is a difference between the Pies on top of the "mash" versus the pies on top. We had one of each, different but both lovely.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

PY3yj066RMUPj3RUDBSwaw.text: HEADS UP TOURISTS! THIS PLACE IS YOUR JAM!I arrived to London and with anguish saw that most of the top rated restos in the city don't serve up the 'typical British cuisine' one is looking to sample as they're touring about. Thankfully I chanced upon Mother Mash and can now depart London confident that I have had a taste of the local cuisine. I love how the menu is set-up; (1) choose your mash, (2) chose your pie and (3) chose your gravy. There were tons of veggie options at each step which was really fantastic. The waitress was sweet and quick to guide us "pie & mash rookies". The food came out quickly and really was fantastic. I got the cheese & mustard mash which had an amazing kick to it! The Mediterranean vegetable pie was flavourful and perfectly cooked (I was worried the insides would be soggy or mushy but they were perfection). It was all topped off with the onion gravy which wasn't too strong and paired well with my pie and mash choices. i ended my meal with ginger bread and custard which could have been a little sweeter. I would recommend going with the ice cream rather than the custard. I was feeling adventurous with the custard but it wasn't particularly to my taste - perhaps a little too authentic for a foreigner. Anyways all of this is to say that if you want to try some proper pie and mash I would seriously recommend this spot! It's not far from Oxford Circus and will really hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

9P7-vYksStkLihoRi4znqw.text: Great traditional British food.  I thought there would be zero to no options for me, as I am vegetarian  but there was an abundance.  Not a place to go if you are vegan,  but otherwise it  was great food.  The gravy,  mash potatoes, pies and sausages were super flavorful and very filling. Great service. Nice servers and great quaint little atmosphere.  If I'm ever in London again, this is a must go place. Plus it's cheap!

eMu2-2HiEenc3xe_L06pNQ.text: THIS is the place I take people from out of town. The great thing about Mother Mash is it's soooooo British (isn't it? Or am I confused? To me it is anyways) because it's got all the stuff- mashed potatoes, peas, bubbles and squeak, sausage, pies, beer...etc. and it tastes WONDERFUL. There's those pubs that serve all those things but the food is only sub-par but people go there because it's British. Mother Mash serves excellent food and the menu is really cool because you can customize it the way you like. First you pick your mash- they've got a wide variety between mashed taters with horseradish, mustard, bubbles and squeak (veggies), sweet potato...etc.  And then you pick your main- a wide selection of sausages and pies (vegetarian options for both), and then your sauce. It's wonderful! The location is equally wonderful- in Carnaby Court right off Regent Street. We've been here a few times and the wait staff is always great.I go vegetarian and I think it's delicious- the bubbles and squeak and horseradish mash is my favorite, and the veggie sausage or goat cheese pie are winners.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. So good!!
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Bubble and squeak potatoes with veggie sausage
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Cheesy cauliflower

gZQDjCarEg46M1T5eILx_w.text: Went on Pi Day!!! This place lived up to its hype. Got the steak pie. So good!!! Loved their thick and savory gravy. Lovely. R.I.P. Stephen Hawking.

AR8ciFKOs_Kd7XXQAX5moQ.text: Very flavorful mashed potatoes gravy and sausage. Service was great but the portion itself was somewhat small.

t4ma6IDgxnXVXK1vGXnukw.text: The place is very much home feel like place and the mash is good, smooth and very tasty!The pie, I'm not really sure as the flavour is a bit bland, the one I had was beef mince pie.The gravy, very tasty and the selection really brings you back to the old English way.Overall, place I will come back with more experiences.Bring your friends in and enjoy the chilled environments

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. The beer, bubble & squeak mash and beef mince pie, with Onion gravy on top. Very nice, apart from the pie maybe a bit undercooked

HmtXtdb9xorgwuub2OoUbA.text: This place is decent for bangers and mash here in London. Service is attentive and the food came out pretty fast.I had the sweet potato mash and opted for the angus steak pie with the farmer's gravy. This was my first time having this type of food. It was really filling, especially for a cold night like this. My bf had three different kinds of sausages and they were super tasty. The sweet potato went well with the farmer's gravy. It wasn't too sweet and more savory. The pie crust was crispy on top and then still held up decently as it soaked in the gravy. The steak was okay tasting, it kind of got lost in the gravy and sweet potato though.Portion sizes are decent and I felt good leaving. They do have desserts and sides you can always add as well as the usual tea, OJ and apple available.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Sweet potato mash and angus steak pie with farmer's gravy.

5D0TfjecqjQnaFDT4JudAg.text: As a vegetarian who loves pies and is often jealous of friends in pubs with no veg pie option, it made me really happy to have several to chose from. The pies I've had are good and reliable, and the mash is tasty. I think of this as more like diner or pub food in a slightly different setting. Wouldn't call it cozy though. Def will go back when I'm in the area, but would not travel across town for it.

QBEnA0LjBo0-0q9Apqdfxg.text: The food was AMAZING but for the service I give it a 0 out of 5, first we asked for recommendations and they didn't help us at all. Then 20 minutes after placing our order the server comes to us and tell us that there was a "problem" with the system so she had to take our order again, and we ended up waiting 40 min for our food, UNACCEPTABLE.

z2cfQJtm-EuJQkkXAIRQNA.text: This was one of the cutest little restaurants we tried in London a simple menu but the food was delicious ! I had the vegetarian option and it was simply delicious ! I wish if you all open a franchise in the USA !! I will go back

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Veggies sausage are the bomb !!

b_8h9CCnMk9wGYDAr1QtSQ.text: I really enjoyed my steak pie and the mashed potatoes were excellent. The staff is a little busy but take good care of you in tight quarters. You will need a reservation for dinner. Also, their molten chocolate cake is great. I didn't care for their ice cream and would recommend their custard instead.

Fl9y8qj9BW9O_WLvoZTPvA.text: This is a hearty meal in the SOHO part of town.  Having walked to this restaurant, my two kids where asking what was so special eating here.  We ordered the mash, sausages and farmers gravy. When the food arrived, there was silence and everyone was digging in.  The meal was a home run and was very satisfying.  My wife had a lemonade and I believe my daughter had a cider with water for the rest of us.   I would come here again to enjoy the mash.

NwwqqOSoSzncqEtuHJ4FpQ.text: This is a little eatery tucked between a several other restaurants and shops in this very walkable strip of Soho.  I wanted to try some traditional British food- participial, pies and mash.  Yelp recommeded Mother Mash which was perfect since I was staying in Soho.  This is a small casual spot, and seating is tight.I had the steak pie and mash.  It was such warm comforting goodness! Also got to have a bite of the mash and sausages- really good, but mine was better.  Get the pie! Service was really friendly and I enjoyed a glass of good red.  Great price and over all experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Steak pie and mash

B0tBZDeOu5i4wU2m1EUmdg.text: We loved this spot for dinner. We took the train and found it in a district with tons of other bars. It wss near the action.It is a small but quaint hole in the wall. The servers are very nice and the service is quick. You pick your mash, your pie, and then your gravy and you are done! We enjoyed the Angus steak pie with our champ mash along with the green beans wrapped in bacon. All the food was prepared with seasonings and flavor beyond my expectations. The server made a mistake on my type of mash potatoes and promptly fixed it with no issue. We also had their bottled cidar. The berry flavored cidar was amazing! The apple pie was so yummy with the ice cream and was large enough for us to share as it came as a small pie with two scoops of vanilla ice cream. This place is not great are large groups as the space is small and seating is tight. Also, they ran out of several desserts on the menu and it was only 830PM. I loved this food at a tourist being able to have traditional food during our stay was important. The Angus was tender, and had a lot of flavor along with sauce in the pie. Be prepared to eat alot of carbs if eating here but it will be well worth the carb overload!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. The apple pie was beyond fresh and tasty
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Inside the steak pie is gravy and chunks of Angus
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Green beans wrapped in bacon

7NRNwabBX6KjH619RCl_Uw.text: Mother smash was the perfect first meal in London. Quick service, excellent homemade style British dinner in a charming setting. Ordered chocolate Warm Carmel dessert that was out of this world. Highly recommend!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Mmmm!!! So good!!!
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Charming setting and amazing meal!!!

KNjyCdahHzvuxtQm6cHZ9A.text: Really cool place. It's tiny like most London restaurants in this area with 3 or 4 tables outside and about half a dozen inside. This is one of those places to sit down and get a quick bite.  This is NOT a 5 star sit and get served places. Its really cool too just get some good English comfort food. The staff is super,  they love tourists and are nice.  Food is good,  stick with traditional stuff like the regular mash and original gravy if you don't have a very seasoned pallet.Definitively will go back

FtAct61u7GIrrvrKJqQA9Q.text: Absolutely delicious. As an American who has never had meat pies with mash and gravy, I am certain it can't get better than this. The thickness of the mash, the crustiness of the mince meat pie, and the smoothness of the gravy was the perfect combination on a rainy London evening. Do yourself a favor, whether you're a tourist or a London native, and EAT HERE.

VcVVN3z_xjYy3istuZ4sVA.text: My wife and I really wanted to try this place after seeing it on yelp. We went by at 5 on a Tuesday but were told they were closed due to a private party so we headed back on Wednesday and arrived at 9:38 PM. We were told they were closed already, I protested and said they listed their hours until 10.  The waitress said she would check with the kitchen and then returned with menus and said we could order but only if we did it quickly! While the waitress stood at the end of the table and a man, who I assume was cook, glared at us with contempt we scanned the menu, ordered the special of the day, one cheesy mash with with sausages, one with smoked sausages and a lamb pie. We asked that the gravy be put on the side on all orders. Our orders arrived fairly quickly and we noticed right away every order was covered in gravy, when we reminded her we ordered it on the side she just said "yeah, the cook got it wrong." as she put the dishes on the table. We did not see her again until she brought the bill, no water refills, no offer of desert......and it was 10:10 when we paid. Oh yeah, the food, it was good, not great, but the horrible service left us with a bad taste in our mouths. My suggestion, skip this place, there are some really good spots with much better food and service in the area.

TFYoh6VEifcJt8hy2J8QxA.text: i found this place to be consistent with the other reviews - very fast, clean, delicious.  I wasn't feeling particularly adventurous so I ordered the cheesy mash, angus steak and traditional gravy.I would recommend this place.

_AE83trlKxFoRvRUz8A0pw.text: Cute place, decently priced but hard to get a table. Service was quite poor.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

kQC_CHaxA_ciy30SscuvdA.text: I was visiting London from NYC.  This place was highly recommended by my boss, who is English, and wow, I loved it so much I came here twice!The food is delicious.  Service is friendly and relatively fast.  The woman behind the counter, who I think maybe is the owner but I'm not sure, was so pleasant.  Bonus points for delicious vegetarian options as well.Highly recommended.

oMzPrNbyCGFBpc9iy0Wrxw.text: Just what it says on the tin. Pies, bangers, mash, gravy -- and done well. The pie I had was truly a good meat pie.If you're in the mood for some true British pub food, without the pub, then this will do you right.

zUhna6hBvN0fSkziklxmlw.text: Disclaimer: This was my very first experience with pie and mash. Though I had a professional Londoner to help me set up my meal. First, I love how the menu was set up, but still needed guidance putting it together (disclaimer number two: I was really, really sick with a cold, which does funny things to your appetite, your taste buds and your ability to read a basic menu).Anyway, at MM it's a three-step process in which you pick your mash, your main (sausage or pie) and your gravy. For me, that was cheesy mash, minced beef pie and traditional gravy (I got a nod of approval from my professional London dining mate, so I think I done good and didn't try to mix up some ridiculous American combo).We placed our order at the hallway-sized restaurant (it's a tight squeeze but done well, a cozy atmosphere and modern), and I headed downstairs to use the bathroom (which felt like navigating around a submarine -- seriously that space it tight). By the time I returned, I was surprised to find the food waiting for me. Wait, what? Did that come frozen and re-heated in a microwave?? I hope not (though for the prices I wouldn't be surprised, this place is rather reasonable for its location).The verdict: it was pretty tasty, but I wasn't in love. My dining mate was unpleasantly surprised as well at their too-quick delivery of our food. It was suspect. But he said it was ok, though like myself, was not overly impressed. The only reason I don't give it another star was because I felt sick to my stomach the rest of the day. In fact, I skipped dinner that night due to the stomach ache. This could be due to my aforementioned cold, but my partner didn't feel so hot and skipped dinner that night as well...so, there you have it. Sorry, Mother Mash, I really wanted to love you.

NAm-OcZD3H7-TCK6RRvuew.text: Rude staff. Worst experience in London.  Has a chain feel to the menu/set-up.  Steer clear. Foreign staff(Soviet Block) who can barely understand conversational English who were definitely working McDonalds the day before.  Didn't want to seat us(2) because they 'had a large party coming into the rear of the restaurant'.  Not sure what that meant for the 4 'deuces' that were available in the front and outside.  We came in around 6pm on a Sat so seemed to me the waitress was at the end of her shift and was training to bounce.  Manager told her to seat us.  We decided to walk out after watching her interaction with the rest of the customers.  Walked out so have no idea about the food.  Don't waste your time, find a Mum & Pops spot vs a chain.

jf1O8aVh0W2pjPBobM7ueQ.text: after struggling with my gps for half an hour, we found it near the piccadilly circus.cute place. i had the mash with horseradish and beer gravy with chicken/chive pie. pie was very good, not as saucy as i expected but very good quality white chicken meat inside. loved the pie, not too big on mash.. but i don't usually like mash anyway. i thought they would have other type of potatoes but nope. i'll give it a three star, it's not really their fault that i dont like mash potatoes.

HI0nd7ECffZdBqKviKpqzg.text: It was delicious! We had the pie and mash and it was so good. It felt like a nice home cook kind of meal that just filled you with warmth. It was certainly the best dinner I had yet on this trip. Everyone seemed to enjoy it including my picky sister. Over all it was a great experience.

HxiF3wfpu5Vu-uQl8xSWrw.text: For a couple of vegetarians traveling in London, finding traditional English food is nearly impossible. We wanted the experience of having sausage, mash, and/or pies and knew it would be hard to find. Luckily I found Mother Mash online before we left for London. We got in exactly at noon when lunch started. The waitress was so friendly and wanted to know a lot about us, our travels, and where we were from.My fiancee ordered the cheesy mustard mash with vegetarian sausage and vegetarian gravy. He says it is the best meal he's ever eaten. The vegetarian sausages are huge and definitely homemade.I ordered the cheesy mustard mash with the vegetarian pie and vegetarian gravy. It was the best meal of my life as well. We dream of the day we can go back to Mother Mash. Definitely my top vegetarian pick for London! I'd recommend it to anyone, vegetarian or not.Also, I must mention, the ambiance of this place is great. People were happy, the cider was flowing. Ahh, memories.

_WlgJNzN2GlJrjrzSrQ3Kw.text: Delicious, hearty meals and prompt, friendly service. I'll definitely be bringing friends here.I had the Champ Mash, Aberdeen Angus steak pie and Farmer's gravy. Yum!

1gYwvAHFmtMAJkfalJ4b5Q.text: This place isn't gourmet- but if your looking for a hearty, warming, meaty portion of sausage and mash then head here. The idea is simple- choose a mash (from 5 options- some with milk and onion, some with cheese, some with bacon...mmm) then choose two sausages- I always mix and match- it doesn't mention this on the menu but they never mind. Then finally what gravy you want- onion, traditional, bacon bit...again. Who cares, you can never have enough bacon!Alternative you can have a pie- I've never had one here before, but always been tempted. Your meal will come to around £9.00, bargain! AND will leave you feeling happy and full. Another bonus is this place serves food quickly, so if you work around Oxford Cirrus you could technically come for your lunch break. Oh and one last thing- a great place to stop and fuel up when you're shopping- Mother Mash is located just off Carnaby Street.

s4WfT63-2R-1DMuovu0VWA.text: Typical well made English food. To bring your family when they are visiting you to taste the authentic traditional English food.

4739p9biCqVae1yi31BBcg.text: To find a tasty meal for under 10 pounds in the heart of London, this place probably deserves 5 stars. On a cold night, the food at Mother Mash definitely hits the spot. You pick a variety of mashed potatoes (I got mash with cheese); you pick a sausage variety (I got beef and bacon); and you pick a gravy (I got the traditional). It was yummy. My only dislike was the super hard, wood bench seats. My tush needs cush to sit on. :)  Not fine dining. Don't go for ambiance. Go for really good comfort food and I don't see how you can be disappointed. Mmm....gravy.....!

uM6sZIf7V_XSOMwQ6v0aPw.text: The Mrs. and I were in London for a short a couple days and we wanted to try some good English Comfort food (funny that we even try, cuz she is a vegetarian! lol) After some searching we chose Mother Mash since it had veggie Bangers and Mash(say what??) Mother Mash is a small but lovely restaurant. The Menu isnt large but the food is pretty darn tasty :) We ordered one order of the veggie bangers and mash and one order of the veggie pie with mash. They offer several different types of mash and topping. I tried the horseradish mash and parsley sauce. The veggie pie and bangers were ok, but the best part of the meal was def. the mash. The mash was light, fluffy and full of taste. For me you could really taste the horseradish, which was great!Mother mash is def, worth a shot, the mash is great and the prices are cheap to London standard. Mind the Gap on the Tube on your way to get some mash!

iTGGM2cf5vhQ6aymdgiXVw.text: I finally perked up the courage to try Mother Mash, after my friends had been raving on & on about it! I was expecting to go in and get that look after asking 'table for one', but just as I was about to ask, I noticed someone coming out with a take-away bag! Yippee! Well that alone earnt itself a star! I was pleasently greeted by a member of staff, who described the slightly complex ordering system (not in the sense that it's difficult, but more along the lines of too much choice for a person), and made my decision.I ordered a sausage meal: Cumberland sausage, mash with cabbage and spring onion & a classic onion gravy. When I opened the box, I was somewhat dissatisfied. I expected a Cumberland ring sausage (or at least that's what I liked the idea of), and another gripe was amount of mash given, for a greedy pig like me I would have liked a little bit more. However, the food tasted great! The sausages could have been cooked a bit more for my liking, but the mash was just right, not crazy creamy, but this wasn't the crown holder, this belonged to the gravy. They got it just right, not too thick, not salty at all, and bits of onion too.All in all I can say that Mother Mash provided more than just a service, this in which made the experience much better, and therefore will most def be back for more, only next time I think I'll have to ask for double portions!!Get yourselves down the for some good ol' British grub!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom

-BMG7vsd1PAvAd1N0rD6hQ.text: Great choice of Pie/Sausage nice simple interior.. However, I think they were having a bad day today.It took good 20 minutes until the one girl serving came up to take what is quite a simple order. To be fair they were very apologetic about how long it was taking.. might have even been first day for the girl taking the orders!.That aside.. The Champ Mash was lovely, Great Chicken, leek and ham pie.. with nice thick smooth gravy.I will go back.. because I love pie and mash,and the girls were very nice!

nuGJX6twn4Jw4hqA7py1kQ.text: Possibly the best sausage and mash IV ever had! Really tasty sausages, lovely creamy mash, and the gravy is even better (which they Arnt tight with by the way)

cT9tPnHrfkVEWFxDs0PQ6w.text: The first time I learned of the difference between mash and bash and bash (mashed potatoes with more texture and less mushy) is the clear winner.  This is a good place for the most traditional English mash/bash, pot pies and sausages.  The steak pie won over the minced meat and lamb pies.  The vote was split between the horseradish vs the cheddar bash but both were good.  I would recommend this place to experience traditional English fare even though I am not a potato lover.  Price is very reasonable around 10 pounds per 3 choices meal.

9mWwyMV4nO3TqsMR15lBMQ.text: My aunt's requested meal during her visit was pie, so there was a bit of pressure on picking a good place for this particular dinner.My aunt had the traditional mince and I had the vegetarian and they were both victims of terrible crust.  One shouldn't need a steak knife to get through the pastry.  Seeing as it was 5 pm (smack in the middle of their opening hours), this isn't easily explainable and makes me want to say, "I've been to PieMinister twice right before they closed and their crust was still good!".  My vegetarian pie guts were pretty disappointing, too... mostly mushy spinach, couldn't really taste much else.  The mash was pretty tasty. The mushy peas were normal, but I thought the serving was pretty skimpy (I wished I'd ordered two). Both my mom and aunt had the Farmer's gravy and raved about it. We also had dessert- an apple and blackberry crumble (meh) and a sticky toffee pudding (awesome!).Service was friendly and satisfactory.  Overall, I think PieMinister beats the pants off of Mother Mash, but this isn't a bad choice for a casual meal in that area!

cZ-m5ssb7pNsrIN13p-0zA.text: As a French, I really enjoyed Mother Mash, an english cheap eat in Soho.The "Bangers and Mash" concept is quite simple. First, you choose between the mash and the bash (with potatoe chunks), as well as the flavour (horseradish, colcannon, champ...) etc. Second, you pick a pie (lamb-rosemary, Aberdeen Angus steak) or a banger. Last but not least, the gravy! With liquor, vegetarian or with mushrooms and bacon. I loved the bash (so tastyyyy), the whole dish was great and generous, not so expensive (£7 for the banger dish) The set was typically english: Wooden booths, marble tables, waitors were OK. You can also have a try on sweet pies...

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Mash - London, United Kingdom. Leek banger and Colcannon Bash

Q7nQM8H2HK2eDYb00z10sA.text: I had the steak pie with Irish mash and traditional gravy and a side of mushy peas. No frills good food. Its tucked away on a really cool street too.

-_zSLJ2rb5MLF72wmCTP1A.text: delicious food.  fun, simple menu.  nice decor.  friendly service.  eat here.  you're welcome.

HO36QX6p4e-MwhIajENV_g.text: This cosy pie/sausage/mash restaurant is only getting more appealing as the winter months (cue rain and cold) rolls in. Choose from pie or sausage, add your choice of mash and gravy and enjoy! Seriously good vegetarian options (right down to veggie gravy), and a well packaged take out option (difficult when you consider the logistical nightmare of transporting gravy) make this an easy choice on a cold winters day. Friendly staff, and good value for money too.

8BNKiVsGZobbOyAoDwsRhw.text: Another one of my London top picks! My friends and I discovered this place about 3 months into our study abroad experience, and altogether I've come about 4 times. I've never tried the sausages here, but I love the lamb and rosemary pie, champ mash, and onion gravy. I think I've gotten it every single time except once. The alcohol selection is a bit limited, but who cares? The food is just amazing-- if you want your beer fix, just hop into the bar next-door. Great service and food.
